New Words.中文: (作為藝術畫廊的策展人，她負責收購新作品和規劃即將舉辦的展覽)。

New Words.句子: The library curator is preparing a special collection of rare manuscripts to be displayed next month
New Words.中文: (圖書館策展人正在準備一個特別的稀有手稿收藏，將於下個月展出)。

New Words.句子: After the divorce, the mother was granted custody of the children
New Words.中文: 離婚後，母親獲得了孩子的監護權。

New Words.句子: The child was placed in the custody of social services after the incident
New Words.中文: 事件發生後，孩子被交給社會服務部門監護。

New Words.句子: The company retained custody of the documents until the investigation was completed
New Words.中文: 公司在調查完成之前保留了文件的監管權。

New Words.句子: He was taken into police custody after the arrest
New Words.中文: 他在被逮捕後被帶入警察拘留所。

New Words.句子: The suspect is still in custody and will appear in court next week
New Words.中文: 嫌疑人仍在拘留中，將於下週出庭。

New Words.句子: The company’s cutting-edge technology has revolutionized the industry
New Words.中文: (該公司的尖端技術顛覆了整個產業。)

New Words.句子: He presented a cutting-edge design for the new stroller that incorporates smart features
New Words.中文: (他提出了一款最先進的新型嬰兒車設計，融入了智能功能。)

New Words.句子: The cutting-edge software is capable of processing data faster than ever before
New Words.中文: (這款最先進的軟體能夠以前所未有的速度處理數據。)

New Words.句子: He's a director who tries to keep his films right on the cutting edge
New Words.中文: (他是一位導演，努力讓自己的電影始終走在時代的最前沿。)

New Words.句子: The engineer calculated the volume of the cylinder using its radius and height
New Words.中文: 工程師使用圓柱的半徑和高度計算了它的體積。

New Words.句子: The gas tank is shaped like a cylinder for better storage and handling
New Words.中文: 汽油箱呈圓柱形，以便於更好的儲存和處理。

New Words.句子: The pipes in the building are cylindrical, allowing smooth water flow
New Words.中文: 大樓中的管道呈圓柱形，這樣可以讓水流更加順暢。

New Words.句子: The car's engine has several cylinders that drive the pistons
New Words.中文: 汽車的引擎有幾個圓柱形的汽缸，用來驅動活塞。

New Words.句子: The hydraulic cylinder is used to lift heavy loads in construction machinery
New Words.中文: 液壓缸用於建築機械中，以提升重物。

New Words.句子: The lamp has a cylindrical base that fits perfectly in the corner
New Words.中文: 這盞燈有一個圓柱形的底座，能完美地放在角落裡。

New Words.句子: The building's design includes several cylindrical columns supporting the roof
New Words.中文: 該建築的設計包括多根圓柱形立柱來支撐屋頂。

New Words.句子: The engineers chose a cylindrical shape for the container to optimize space and strength
New Words.中文: 工程師選擇圓柱形容器，以優化空間和強度。

New Words.句子: The damp in the basement caused the wooden furniture to warp
New Words.中文: 地下室的潮濕使得木製家具變形。

New Words.句子: He wiped off the damp from the window with a cloth
New Words.中文: 他用布擦去窗戶上的潮濕。

New Words.句子: The clothes felt damp after being left out in the cool air
New Words.中文: 衣服在涼爽的空氣中晾了一會兒後，變得有些潮濕。

New Words.句子: The damp ground made it difficult to set up the tent
New Words.中文: 潮濕的地面使得搭帳篷變得困難。

New Words.句子: The rain damped their enthusiasm for the outdoor event
New Words.中文: 雨水減弱了他們對戶外活動的熱情。

New Words.句子: She damped the cloth to clean the dusty surface
New Words.中文: 她弄濕了布料來清潔塵土飛揚的表面。

New Words.句子: The noise from the party was damped by the thick walls of the building
New Words.中文: 派對的噪音被大樓厚重的牆壁隔絕了。

New Words.句子: The keys dangled from her fingers as she walked
New Words.中文: 她走路時，鑰匙從她手指間晃蕩著。

New Words.句子: A necklace dangled from her neck, catching the sunlight
New Words.中文: 一條項鍊從她脖子上垂下來，映著陽光閃閃發亮。

New Words.句子: The curtain dangled from the rod, loosely hanging to the floor
New Words.中文: 窗簾從桿子上垂下來，鬆散地掛到地板上。

New Words.句子: The promise of a bonus dangled before the employees, motivating them to work harder
New Words.中文: 獎金的承諾在員工面前晃蕩，激勵他們更加努力工作。

New Words.句子: She dangled the idea of a vacation in front of her children, but they didn't know when it would happen
New Words.中文: 她在她孩子面前提起了度假的想法，但他們不知道什麼時候會實現。

New Words.句子: The negotiations deadlocked when both parties refused to budge on their demands
New Words.中文: 當雙方都不肯在各自的要求上讓步時，談判陷入了僵局。

New Words.句子: The two teams deadlocked in a scoreless match
New Words.中文: 兩支隊伍在沒有得分的比賽中陷入僵局。

New Words.句子: Her home run deadlocked the game at 3–3
New Words.中文: 她的一記全壘打讓比賽以3比3陷入僵局。

New Words.句子: The board meeting ended in a deadlock, with no decision reached on the proposed merger
New Words.中文: 董事會會議以僵局告終，對於提議的合併案未能達成任何決定。

New Words.句子: Today's meeting with the supervisor regarding employee workload ended in a deadlock
New Words.中文: 今天與主管關於員工工作量的會議以僵局結束。

New Words.句子: After the storm, debris from fallen trees covered the streets
New Words.中文: 暴風雨過後，倒下的樹木殘骸覆蓋了街道。

New Words.句子: The explosion left debris scattered across the entire area
New Words.中文: 爆炸後，殘骸散落在整個區域。

New Words.句子: Workers cleared the construction debris from the site
New Words.中文: 工人們清理了工地上的建築殘骸。

New Words.句子: The actress made her film debut at the age of sixteen
New Words.中文: 這位女演員在十六歲時首次參與電影演出。

New Words.句子: His debut as a conductor was highly praised by critics
New Words.中文: 他作為指揮家的首次亮相受到評論家的高度讚揚。

New Words.句子: The new smartphone will have its debut next month
New Words.中文: 這款新智慧型手機將於下個月首次亮相。

New Words.句子: The singer debuted her new song on live television
New Words.中文: 這位歌手在電視直播中首次演唱了她的新歌。

New Words.句子: The product debuted to great fanfare at the tech conference
New Words.中文: 這款產品在科技大會上隆重亮相。

New Words.句子: He debuted as a professional basketball player last season
New Words.中文: 他在上個賽季首次以職業籃球員的身份亮相。

New Words.句子: Your debut isn’t just your first step—it’s your statement to the world.
New Words.中文: 出道不只是第一步，而是你向世界宣告自己的時刻。

New Words.句子: A strong debut shows promise, but staying great takes dedication.
New Words.中文: 強勢的初登場展現潛力，而持續卓越則需要奉獻。

New Words.句子: Style isn’t about trends—it’s about making a timeless debut.
New Words.中文: 風格不是追隨潮流，而是創造永恆的初印象。

New Words.句子: The dentist warned him about tooth decay caused by too much sugar
New Words.中文: 牙醫警告他，過多的糖分會導致牙齒蛀壞。

New Words.句子: The old house showed signs of decay, with crumbling walls and broken windows
New Words.中文: 那座老房子顯示出衰敗的跡象，牆壁崩塌，窗戶破裂。

New Words.句子: The decay of moral values in society was a concern for many
New Words.中文: 社會道德價值的衰退令許多人感到擔憂。

New Words.句子: The once-great empire fell into decay over the centuries
New Words.中文: 那個曾經偉大的帝國在幾個世紀裡陷入了衰亡。

New Words.句子: The fallen leaves began to decay on the forest floor
New Words.中文: 落葉開始在森林地面上腐爛。

New Words.句子: If food is left out for too long, it will start to decay
New Words.中文: 如果食物被放置太久，就會開始腐壞。

New Words.句子: His memory started to decay with age
New Words.中文: 隨著年齡增長，他的記憶開始衰退。

New Words.句子: Without proper maintenance, the building will quickly decay
New Words.中文: 如果沒有適當的維護，這棟建築很快就會衰敗。

New Words.句子: The con artist's deceit was exposed when his lies were uncovered by authorities
New Words.中文: 當騙子的謊言被當局揭穿時，他的欺騙行為暴露了出來。

New Words.句子: Her deceit in the business deal caused a major loss of trust
New Words.中文: 她在商業交易中的欺騙行為造成了信任的重大損失。

New Words.句子: He used deceit to gain access to confidential information
New Words.中文: 他使用欺騙手段獲取機密信息。

New Words.句子: She deceived him into believing that she was wealthy
New Words.中文: 她欺騙他，讓他相信她很富有。

New Words.句子: The company was accused of deceiving customers with false advertising
New Words.中文: 該公司被指控通過虛假廣告欺騙顧客。

New Words.句子: He tried to deceive his parents about where he had been
New Words.中文: 他試圖欺騙父母，隱瞞自己去哪裡了。

New Words.句子: Don’t be deceived by appearances; the situation is more complicated than it looks
New Words.中文: 不要被表象所欺騙；這個情況比看起來更複雜。

New Words.句子: It is easier to deceive others than to convince them they have been deceived.
New Words.中文: 欺騙他人容易，要讓他們相信自己被騙才難。

New Words.句子: Those who control the truth often deceive without ever uttering a lie.
New Words.中文: 控制真相的人，往往能在不說謊的情況下進行欺騙。

New Words.句子: As they approached the intersection, the driver began to decelerate, preparing to stop at the red light
New Words.中文: 當他們接近十字路口時，司機開始減速，準備在紅燈前停下來。

New Words.句子: Experts predict that economic growth will decelerate
New Words.中文: 專家預測經濟增長將會放緩。

New Words.句子: He was admired for his decency and honesty in all his dealings
New Words.中文: 他因在所有交易中的正直與誠實而受到欽佩。

New Words.句子: Despite the heated debate, they maintained a level of decency toward each other
New Words.中文: 儘管辯論激烈，他們仍然對彼此保持一定程度的禮貌。

New Words.句子: If you're going to be late, please have the decency to call and let me know
New Words.中文: 如果你會遲到，請有禮貌地打電話通知我。

New Words.句子: These deceptions cost them dear
New Words.中文: 這些欺騙讓他們付出了慘重的代價。

New Words.句子: After years of trusting their financial advisor, they discovered that he had been involved in fraudulent schemes
New Words.中文: 經過多年信任他們的財務顧問後，他們發現他一直參與詐騙計劃。

New Words.句子: Sheila's decisive leadership style enabled the team to swiftly navigate through challenges and achieve their goals with precision and efficiency
New Words.中文: Sheila 果斷的領導風格使團隊能夠迅速應對挑戰，並以精確和高效的方式實現目標。

New Words.句子: In photography, capturing a decisive moment often requires both skill and intuition, freezing a fleeting instant in time that tells a powerful story
New Words.中文: 在攝影中，捕捉決定性瞬間通常需要技巧和直覺，將轉瞬即逝的時刻凝固，講述一個震撼人心的故事。

New Words.句子: The president’s declaration of the new policy changes was broadcast nationwide
New Words.中文: 總統宣佈新政策變動的消息已在全國廣播。

New Words.句子: Her declaration of intent to run for office gathered a lot of media attention
New Words.中文: 她宣布有意參選的聲明引起了大量媒體關注。

New Words.句子: His declaration of innocence convinced the jury to consider his case carefully
New Words.中文: 他聲明自己無辜的話語說服了陪審團仔細考慮他的案件。

New Words.句子: The company's declaration about its environmental efforts was well-received by the community
New Words.中文: 該公司關於其環保努力的聲明受到社區的好評。

New Words.句子: The Declaration of Independence is one of the most important documents in American history
New Words.中文: 《獨立宣言》是美國歷史上最重要的文件之一。

New Words.句子: The court required a signed declaration of assets from the defendant
New Words.中文: 法院要求被告提供簽署的財產聲明。

New Words.句子: The living room's decor was modern, with sleek furniture and neutral tones
New Words.中文: (客廳的裝潢現代時尚，配有流線型家具和中性色調。)

New Words.句子: The living room's decor was modern, with sleek furniture and neutral tones
New Words.中文: 客廳的裝潢是現代風格，配有線條流暢的傢俱和中性色調。你想我幫你翻譯更多類似句子嗎？

New Words.句子: She spent hours perfecting the decor for her wedding, choosing elegant flowers and vintage decorations
New Words.中文: (她花了數小時精心布置婚禮裝飾，選擇優雅的花卉和復古裝飾品。)

New Words.句子: She spent hours perfecting the decor for her wedding, choosing elegant flowers and vintage decorations
New Words.中文: 她花了好幾個小時來完善婚禮的布置，精心挑選優雅的花卉和復古的裝飾品。你需要我幫你整理這些句子的主題分類嗎？

New Words.句子: The restaurant’s decor had an industrial feel, with exposed brick walls and metal furniture
New Words.中文: (這家餐廳的裝飾帶有工業風格，具有裸露的磚牆和金屬家具。)

New Words.句子: The restaurant’s decor had an industrial feel, with exposed brick walls and metal furniture
New Words.中文: 這家餐廳的裝潢帶有工業風格，牆面裸露的紅磚搭配金屬家具。你想繼續蒐集與「decor」相關的句子嗎？

New Words.句子: Thoughtful décor isn’t about luxury—it’s about creating a space that tells your story.
New Words.中文: 用心的裝飾不在於奢華，而在於營造出講述你故事的空間。

New Words.句子: Elegance begins with simplicity, even in the décor.
New Words.中文: 優雅始於簡約，連居家裝飾亦是如此。

New Words.句子: She performed a heroic deed by saving the child from the burning building
New Words.中文: 她通過將孩子從燃燒的建築中救出，完成了一項英雄壯舉。

New Words.句子: His good deeds in the community earned him the respect of his peers
New Words.中文: 他在社區中的善行贏得了同儕的尊重。

New Words.句子: The thief was caught after committing several criminal deeds
New Words.中文: 那名小偷在犯下幾起罪行後被抓獲。

New Words.句子: The house was officially transferred to him through a deed of sale
New Words.中文: 這棟房子通過一份銷售契約正式轉讓給了他。

New Words.句子: The lawyer presented the deed as proof of ownership of the land
New Words.中文: 律師將契約呈交作為土地所有權的證明。

New Words.句子: The board deemed the proposal beneficial for the company’s future
New Words.中文: 董事會認為該提案對公司未來有利。

New Words.句子: She was deemed qualified for the position after a thorough review
New Words.中文: 經過徹底審查後，她被認為符合該職位的資格。

New Words.句子: The project was deemed successful based on the positive feedback
New Words.中文: 根據正面的反饋，該項目被認為是成功的。

New Words.句子: The responsibility has been deemed too burdensome for one person to handle
New Words.中文: 這項責任已被認為對一個人來說過於沉重，無法承擔。

New Words.句子: The building was deemed [=considered, judged] unsafe after the fire
New Words.中文: 這座建築在火災後被認為（= 被視為、判定為）不安全。

New Words.句子: He deemed that it was his duty to help the needy
New Words.中文: 他認為幫助有需要的人是他的責任。

New Words.句子: The company went into default on its loan
New Words.中文: 該公司未能履行其貸款義務。

New Words.句子: He was sued for defaulting on his rent payments
New Words.中文: 他因未支付租金而被起訴。

New Words.句子: The default setting on the computer was set to automatic updates
New Words.中文: 電腦的預設設定為自動更新。

New Words.句子: The default font in the document is Times New Roman
New Words.中文: 文件中的預設字型是 Times New Roman。

New Words.句子: No one else wanted the job, so he became the club's president by default
New Words.中文: 沒有人願意接這份工作，所以他自動成為了俱樂部的會長。

New Words.句子: We won the game by default when the other team failed to show up
New Words.中文: 當對方隊伍未能出現時，我們自動贏得了比賽。

New Words.句子: If you default on your mortgage, you could lose your home
New Words.中文: 如果你未能償還房貸，可能會失去你的家。

New Words.句子: After the power outage, the system defaulted to its original settings
New Words.中文: 停電後，系統自動恢復到原始設定。

New Words.句子: The player defaulted in the tournament because of her injury
New Words.中文: 該名選手因為受傷而在比賽中棄權。

New Words.句子: He defrauded them of their money
New Words.中文: 他詐騙了他們的錢。

New Words.句子: Using deft strokes of the brush, the artist created a masterpiece that captured the essence of the sunset
New Words.中文: 藝術家用巧妙的畫筆 strokes 創作了一幅捕捉日落精髓的傑作。

New Words.句子: She deftly navigated through the crowded streets, weaving between pedestrians with graceful ease
New Words.中文: 她熟練地穿梭在擁擠的街道上，輕盈地在人群中穿行。

New Words.句子: The company's management employed a delaying tactic by promising to address employee concerns in the next quarterly meeting, effectively postponing any immediate action on the matter
New Words.中文: 公司的管理層採取了一種拖延戰術，承諾在下一次的季度會議上處理員工的疑慮，藉此有效地延後了對此事的即時行動。

New Words.句子: The politician employed a delaying tactic by requesting additional time to review the proposed legislation, knowing that it would buy them more time to gather support from undecided colleagues
New Words.中文: 這位政治人物採取了拖延戰術，要求更多時間來審查所提議的法案，心知這樣可以爭取更多時間，來爭取尚未表態的同僚支持。

New Words.句子: She handled the delicate china teacup with great care
New Words.中文: 她非常小心地拿著那只精緻的瓷茶杯。

New Words.句子: The delicate aroma of the flowers filled the room
New Words.中文: 花朵細緻的香氣瀰漫整個房間。

New Words.句子: The doctor gave delicate advice on how to manage the patient's condition
New Words.中文: 醫生給出了細緻的建議，說明如何處理病人的病情。

New Words.句子: He made a delicate remark to avoid offending anyone
New Words.中文: 他做出了一個委婉的評論，以避免冒犯任何人。

New Words.句子: Despite the stressful situation, her calm and composed demeanor helped reassure everyone around her
New Words.中文: 儘管情況壓力重重，她冷靜沉著的舉止讓周圍的每個人都感到安心。

New Words.句子: I dislike his pompous demeanor
New Words.中文: 我不喜歡他那自以為是的態度。

New Words.句子: She had a shy demeanor that made her seem approachable and humble
New Words.中文: 她有著害羞的舉止，讓她看起來平易近人且謙遜。

New Words.句子: His friendly demeanor made everyone feel at ease during the meeting
New Words.中文: 他友善的舉止讓大家在會議中都感到輕鬆自在。

New Words.句子: In the city center, buildings are densely packed, creating a bustling urban environment
New Words.中文: 在市中心，建築物密集地排列著，營造出一個繁忙熱鬧的都市環境。

New Words.句子: Her speech was densely packed with information, leaving the audience impressed but overwhelmed
New Words.中文: 她的演講內容資訊非常密集，讓觀眾印象深刻但也感到有些不堪負荷。

New Words.句子: The town square was densely crowded with people enjoying the festival
New Words.中文: 鎮上的廣場擠滿了人群，大家都在享受節日的歡樂氣氛。

New Words.句子: The forest was densely populated with tall trees and thick undergrowth
New Words.中文: 這片森林密布著高大的樹木和茂密的灌木叢。

New Words.句子: Her departure from the company surprised her colleagues
New Words.中文: 她離開公司讓同事們感到驚訝。

New Words.句子: The train's departure is scheduled for 9:00 AM
New Words.中文: 火車的開車時間定於早上9點。

New Words.句子: His sudden departure from the event raised many questions
New Words.中文: 他突然離開活動引起了許多疑問。

New Words.句子: The artist's new style was a departure from his earlier, more traditional work
New Words.中文: 這位藝術家的新風格與他早期更傳統的作品有所不同。

New Words.句子: The policy marked a departure from previous government approaches
New Words.中文: 這項政策標誌著與以往政府做法的不同。

New Words.句子: This innovative design represents a significant departure from conventional architecture
New Words.中文: 這個創新的設計代表了對傳統建築的重大突破。

New Words.句子: The airport announced the departure of Flight 303
New Words.中文: 機場公告了303航班的起飛。

New Words.句子: We all gathered at the gate to bid him farewell before his departure
New Words.中文: 在他離開之前，我們都聚集在門口為他送行。

New Words.句子: The departure of the cruise ship was delayed due to weather conditions
New Words.中文: 由於天氣狀況，郵輪的起航被延遲。

New Words.句子: His enemies depict [=portray] him as a cruel and dangerous leader
New Words.中文: 他的敵人將他描繪成一位殘忍而危險的領袖。

New Words.句子: The book depicts him as a rather unpleasant character
New Words.中文: 這本書將他描繪成一個相當令人不快的角色。

New Words.句子: The travel brochure depicts the idyllic beaches and charming coastal towns of the Mediterranean region, inviting tourists to experience its beauty firsthand
New Words.中文: 旅遊手冊描繪了地中海地區那如畫般的海灘和迷人的海濱小鎮，邀請遊客親身體驗其美麗。

New Words.句子: The artist's depiction of the historical event in her painting captured the emotions and atmosphere of the moment
New Words.中文: 這位藝術家在畫作中對歷史事件的描繪，捕捉了當時的情感和氛圍。

New Words.句子: The storyteller's vivid depiction (also description) of the ancient battle transported the audience back in time, as they could almost hear the clash of swords and the roar of warriors
New Words.中文: 故事講述者生動的描繪（也可稱為描述）將觀眾帶回了古代戰鬥的時光，彷彿他們能聽到劍鋒相交的聲音和戰士們的怒吼。

New Words.句子: Overfishing can deplete fish populations, threatening their survival
New Words.中文: 過度捕撈可能會耗盡魚類數量，威脅其生存。

New Words.句子: Activities such as logging and mining deplete our natural resources
New Words.中文: 伐木和採礦等活動會耗盡我們的自然資源。

New Words.句子: We completely depleted our life savings when we bought our new house
New Words.中文: 我們在購買新房時完全耗盡了畢生積蓄。

New Words.句子: The word "biology" is derived from the Greek words for "life" and "study
New Words.中文: 「生物學」一詞源自於希臘語中「生命」和「學習」的詞彙。

New Words.句子: She derived great satisfaction from her work in the community
New Words.中文: 她從自己在社區中的工作中獲得了極大的滿足感。

New Words.句子: The design of this chair derives inspiration from mid-century modern aesthetics
New Words.中文: 這把椅子的設計汲取了中世紀現代美學的靈感。

New Words.句子: My name is derived from an ancient language meaning "brave warrior
New Words.中文: 我的名字源自一種古老的語言，意思是「勇敢的戰士」。

New Words.句子: We can derive that it will rain tomorrow because the sky is very cloudy
New Words.中文: 我們可以推斷明天會下雨，因為天空雲層密布。

New Words.句子: She derived the answer to the math problem by using a formula she learned in class
New Words.中文: 她通過使用課堂上學到的公式，得出了這道數學題的答案。

New Words.句子: The plane began to descend as it approached the airport
New Words.中文: 當飛機接近機場時，它開始下降。

New Words.句子: He is descended from Confucius
New Words.中文: 他是孔子的後裔。

New Words.句子: The family estate will descend to the eldest son
New Words.中文: 家族的財產將傳給長子。

New Words.句子: The custom has descended to our day
New Words.中文: 這個習俗一直延續到今天。

New Words.句子: Recent evidence supports the theory that birds descended from dinosaurs
New Words.中文: 最近的證據支持了鳥類源自恐龍的理論。

New Words.句子: The soldiers descended on the enemy camp at dawn
New Words.中文: 士兵們在黎明時分突襲了敵人的營地。

New Words.句子: Bob and his girl friend descended on us for the weekend
New Words.中文: 鮑勃和他的女朋友突然來找我們度過週末。

New Words.句子: In autumn [=fall], thousands of students descend upon [=visit] our town
New Words.中文: 在秋天，成千上萬的學生湧入我們的城鎮。

New Words.句子: Silence descended upon the crowd
New Words.中文: 寂靜降臨在人群中。

New Words.句子: Bob and his girlfriend descended on us for the weekend
New Words.中文: 鮑勃和他的女朋友週末突然來訪我們家。

New Words.句子: Wait for the elevator to descend
New Words.中文: 等待電梯下降。

New Words.句子: You can ride the escalator up but have to descend on foot
New Words.中文: 你可以乘坐扶手電梯向上，但必須步行下來。

New Words.句子: Descending the mountain was even more dangerous than climbing [=ascending] it
New Words.中文: 下山比爬山更危險。

New Words.句子: The children descended the staircase silently
New Words.中文: 孩子們悄悄地下樓梯。

New Words.句子: The cat slowly descended from the tree after being stuck for hours
New Words.中文: 貓咪在被困了幾個小時後，慢慢地從樹上爬了下來。

New Words.句子: After his wife died, he descended [=sank] into a deep depression
New Words.中文: 在妻子去世後，他陷入了深深的抑鬱。

New Words.句子: As the evening wore on, the party descended into chaos
New Words.中文: 隨著夜晚的推移，派對陷入了混亂。

New Words.句子: She descends from a long line of artists
New Words.中文: 她出身於一個藝術世家。

New Words.句子: Many people in this area are descendants of German immigrants
New Words.中文: 這個地區的許多人是德國移民的後代。

New Words.句子: Recent evidence supports the theory that birds are the modern descendants of dinosaurs
New Words.中文: 最近的證據支持了鳥類是恐龍現代後代的理論。

New Words.句子: The royal family can trace its descendants back hundreds of years
New Words.中文: 皇室家族可以追溯到數百年前的後代。

New Words.句子: Modern languages like French and Spanish are descendants of Latin
New Words.中文: 像法語和西班牙語這樣的現代語言是拉丁語的後代。

New Words.句子: Today’s smartphones are descendants of the early mobile phones
New Words.中文: 今天的智能手機是早期移動電話的後代。

New Words.句子: The company's new software is a descendant of its first-generation product
New Words.中文: 該公司新軟體是其第一代產品的後代。

New Words.句子: The airplane began its gradual descent toward the airport
New Words.中文: （飛機開始向機場進行逐漸下降。）

New Words.句子: The hikers struggled during the steep descent from the mountain
New Words.中文: （登山者在從山頂的陡峭下降過程中掙扎。）

New Words.句子: His career took a sudden descent after the scandal
New Words.中文: （他的職業生涯在醜聞後突然下滑。）

New Words.句子: She is of French descent and speaks the language fluently
New Words.中文: （她有法國血統，並且流利地講法語。）

New Words.句子: Many people in the region can trace their descent back to ancient tribes
New Words.中文: （該地區的許多人可以追溯他們的血統到古代部落。）

New Words.句子: His descent from a noble family was well-documented
New Words.中文: （他來自一個貴族家庭的血統有著充分的文獻記錄。）

New Words.句子: The descent of the enemy troops caught them off guard
New Words.中文: （敵軍的下坡進攻讓他們措手不及。）

New Words.句子: The town prepared for the sudden descent of tourists during the festival
New Words.中文: （城鎮為節日期間突如其來的遊客湧入做好了準備。）

New Words.句子: After months of searching for a job with no success, she was growing desperate for a source of income
New Words.中文: 經過幾個月的求職但始終未能成功，她開始對找到收入來源感到絕望。

New Words.句子: Her desperate attempts to please everyone only led to disappointment and exhaustion
New Words.中文: 她為取悅每個人的絕望嘗試只帶來了失望和疲憊。

New Words.句子: In his desperate attempt to escape, he jumped from the moving train
New Words.中文: 在他絕望的逃脫嘗試中，他從行駛中的火車上跳了下來。

New Words.句子: A desperate man will stop at nothing to get what he wants
New Words.中文: 一個絕望的人會不擇手段地得到他想要的東西。

New Words.句子: He was desperate for companionship after spending months alone in the wilderness
New Words.中文: 在荒野中獨自度過了幾個月後，他渴望得到陪伴。

New Words.句子: He was desperate for work to provide for a large family
New Words.中文: 他迫切需要工作來養活一個大家庭。

New Words.句子: She searched desperately for her lost keys, knowing she would be late if she couldn't find them soon
New Words.中文: 她絕望地尋找著丟失的鑰匙，知道如果不能很快找到它們，她就會遲到。

New Words.句子: He pleaded desperately with the airline agent to find him another flight after discovering his original one was canceled
New Words.中文: 在發現原本的航班被取消後，他絕望地向航空公司代理人懇求，要求幫他找另一班航班。

New Words.句子: The man in the river desperately tried to reach the side.
New Words.中文: 河中的那名男子絕望地試圖游向岸邊。

New Words.句子: Despite the rain, we went for a walk in the park
New Words.中文: 儘管下著雨，我們還是去公園散步了。

New Words.句子: Even though it was raining, we went for a walk in the park
New Words.中文: 儘管在下雨，我們還是去公園散步了。

New Words.句子: She went out for a walk, though it was raining
New Words.中文: 雖然下著雨，她還是出去散步了。

New Words.句子: Although it was raining, we went for a walk in the park
New Words.中文: 雖然在下雨，我們還是去公園散步了。

New Words.句子: This money is destined for a new house
New Words.中文: 這筆錢注定用來購買新房子。

New Words.句子: The room was destined to become a nursery for the new baby
New Words.中文: 這個房間注定成為新生嬰兒的嬰兒房。

New Words.句子: The couple believed they were destined to be together
New Words.中文: 這對夫婦相信他們注定要在一起。

New Words.句子: He spoke about the tragedy with surprising detachment
New Words.中文: 他以出乎意料的冷漠談論這場悲劇。

New Words.句子: Emotional detachment can sometimes be a coping mechanism during stressful situations
New Words.中文: 情感上的冷漠有時候可以是應對壓力情況的應對機制。

New Words.句子: The detachment of the upper frame allowed the stroller to convert into a cart
New Words.中文: 上框架的分離使得這款推車能夠轉換成手推車。

New Words.句子: The detachment of the painting from the wall required careful handling
New Words.中文: 將畫作從牆上取下需要小心處理。

New Words.句子: A military detachment was sent to assist with disaster relief efforts
New Words.中文: 一支軍事分隊被派遣協助災後救援工作。

New Words.句子: The small detachment patrolled the remote area regularly
New Words.中文: 這支小型分隊定期巡邏偏遠地區。

New Words.句子: Without proper maintenance, the building will gradually deteriorate
New Words.中文: 如果沒有適當的維護，這棟建築將會逐漸惡化。

New Words.句子: Exposure to rain and sun will gradually deteriorate the paint
New Words.中文: 長時間曝露在雨水和陽光下會使油漆逐漸劣化。

New Words.句子: Her health began to deteriorate after she stopped taking her medication
New Words.中文: 在她停止服藥後，她的健康開始惡化。

New Words.句子: The relationship deteriorated due to constant misunderstandings and lack of communication
New Words.中文: 由於不斷的誤解和缺乏溝通，這段關係逐漸惡化。

New Words.句子: Economic conditions deteriorated rapidly during the financial crisis
New Words.中文: 經濟情況在金融危機期間迅速惡化。

New Words.句子: The old building showed clear signs of deterioration due to neglect
New Words.中文: 這座舊建築因疏忽而顯示出明顯的劣化跡象。

New Words.句子: His health has been in steady deterioration over the past year
New Words.中文: 他的健康在過去一年中一直在穩定惡化。

New Words.句子: The economic deterioration led to widespread unemployment
New Words.中文: 經濟衰退導致了廣泛的失業。

New Words.句子: The deterioration of air quality in the city has become a major concern
New Words.中文: 城市空氣質量的惡化已成為一個重大關注問題。

New Words.句子: The minor flaws in the painting did not detract from its overall beauty
New Words.中文: 畫作中的些許瑕疵並未減損其整體之美。

New Words.句子: The loud noise from the construction site detracts from the beauty of the park
New Words.中文: 施工現場的噪音削弱了公園的美感。

New Words.句子: Her minor mistakes did not detract from the overall excellence of her performance
New Words.中文: 她些許的錯誤並未減損她整體表現的卓越。

New Words.句子: The flashy design of the website detracts from its usability
New Words.中文: 網站華而不實的設計削弱了其可用性。

New Words.句子: The scandal will not detract from his fame
New Words.中文: 這場醜聞不會減損他的名聲。

New Words.句子: The neighborhood residents were concerned about the presence of deviant behavior, leading to calls for increased police patrols
New Words.中文: 社區居民對不良行為的存在感到擔憂，並因此呼籲加強警察巡邏。

New Words.句子: The artist's unconventional approach to painting was celebrated by some but considered deviant by traditionalists
New Words.中文: 這位藝術家對繪畫的非傳統方式受到一些人的讚賞，但對傳統主義者來說則被視為偏離常規。

New Words.句子: The company's financial report showed several deviant trends compared to industry benchmarks, raising questions about its performance
New Words.中文: 該公司的財務報告顯示出與行業基準相比的幾個異常趨勢，引發了對其表現的質疑。

New Words.句子: The anthropologist observed cultural practices that were considered deviant by outsiders but held deep significance within the community
New Words.中文: 人類學家觀察到一些外人視為異常的文化習俗，但這些習俗在社區內具有深遠的意義。

New Words.句子: The documentary explores various deviant sexual practices, shedding light on alternative lifestyles and challenging societal norms regarding intimacy and relationships
New Words.中文: 這部紀錄片探討了各種被視為偏離常規的性行為，揭示了替代性生活方式並挑戰了社會對親密關係和人際關係的規範。

New Words.句子: It's important to remember that just because someone engages in deviant behavior doesn't mean they're a bad person; there may be underlying factors we don't understand
New Words.中文: 重要的是要記住，僅僅因為某人從事偏離常規的行為並不代表他們是壞人；背後可能有我們無法理解的原因。

New Words.句子: The community was shocked to learn that one of their neighbors had been labeled a deviant by the authorities, as he always seemed so friendly and normal
New Words.中文: 社區居民得知他們的一位鄰居被當局標籤為異常人物時感到震驚，因為他總是看起來如此友好和正常。

New Words.句子: The project deviated from its original plan due to unforeseen circumstances
New Words.中文: 由於不可預見的情況，該項目偏離了原計劃。

New Words.句子: The politician's statements seemed to deviate from his party's official stance on the issue
New Words.中文: 那位政治家的言論似乎偏離了他所在政黨在該問題上的官方立場。

New Words.句子: The company implemented measures to prevent deviate practices in its supply chain
New Words.中文: 公司採取了措施來防止供應鏈中出現偏離常規的行為。

New Words.句子: The psychologist studied the mind of a deviate to understand the underlying causes of criminal behavior
New Words.中文: 心理學家研究了一位偏離常規者的思維，以了解犯罪行為背後的根本原因。

New Words.句子: The student's behavior showed a clear deviation from the school's code of conduct, prompting a meeting with the principal
New Words.中文: 學生的行為明顯偏離了學校的行為準則，促使與校長召開會議。

New Words.句子: The airplane encountered strong winds, causing it to make a slight deviation from its planned flight path
New Words.中文: 飛機遇到強風，導致航道輕微偏離預定航線。

New Words.句子: The company's profits for the quarter showed a deviation from the industry average, raising concerns among shareholders
New Words.中文: 公司本季度的利潤與行業平均水平有所偏差，引發了股東們的擔憂。

New Words.句子: The quality control team identified a deviation in the product specifications, leading to adjustments in the manufacturing process
New Words.中文: 質量控制團隊發現產品規格的偏差，並對製造過程進行了調整。

New Words.句子: The employee's consistent tardiness was viewed as a deviation from company policy, resulting in disciplinary action
New Words.中文: 員工一再遲到被視為偏離公司政策，並因此受到紀律處分。

New Words.句子: The devious salesman manipulated his customers into buying unnecessary products
New Words.中文: 那位狡猾的推銷員操控顧客購買不必要的產品。

New Words.句子: Instead of confronting the issue directly, she took a devious approach by spreading rumors about her rival
New Words.中文: 她沒有直接面對問題，而是採取了狡猾的方式，散播關於競爭對手的謠言。

New Words.句子: He took a devious route through the back alleys and side streets to avoid the heavy traffic on the main roads during rush hour
New Words.中文: 他選擇了穿過後巷和側街的狡猾路線，避開了高峰時段主要道路上的擁堵交通。

New Words.句子: His devious plan to sabotage his competitor’s business was finally exposed
New Words.中文: 他那個破壞競爭對手生意的狡詐計劃終於曝光了。

New Words.句子: The team worked together to devise a new marketing strategy to attract customers to their product
New Words.中文: 團隊合作設計了一個新的行銷策略，旨在吸引顧客購買他們的產品。

New Words.句子: She devised an innovative way to reduce waste in the office, improving the company’s sustainability efforts
New Words.中文: 她設計了一種創新的方法來減少辦公室的浪費，改善公司的可持續發展努力。

New Words.句子: To solve the impossible, you must first devise what others dare not imagine.
New Words.中文: 要解決不可能的問題，首先得設計出他人不敢想像的方案。

New Words.句子: They devised a plan to improve the neighborhood park, making it more accessible to children and families
New Words.中文: 他們設計了一個計劃來改善社區公園，使其對兒童和家庭更具可達性。

New Words.句子: The pianist’s dexterity allowed her to play complex pieces effortlessly
New Words.中文: 鋼琴家的靈巧使她能輕鬆地彈奏複雜的曲目。

New Words.句子: He showed great dexterity in tying the intricate knots
New Words.中文: 他在綁複雜的結時展現了極高的靈巧。

New Words.句子: The surgeon’s dexterity was evident as he performed the delicate operation
New Words.中文: 外科醫生的靈巧在他進行精細手術時展現得淋漓盡致。

New Words.句子: Her dexterity in managing multiple tasks at once made her a highly valued team member
New Words.中文: 她在同時處理多項任務的靈活性使她成為團隊中極具價值的成員。

New Words.句子: His mental dexterity helped him navigate through the tricky negotiations with ease
New Words.中文: 他的心智能力幫助他輕鬆應對棘手的談判。

New Words.句子: He was diagnosed with type 1 diabetes at a young age and requires insulin injections daily
New Words.中文: 他在年輕時被診斷為1型糖尿病，並且每天需要注射胰島素。

New Words.句子: Living with type 1 diabetes means being strong, disciplined, and always prepared—but it never means giving up.
New Words.中文: 與第一型糖尿病共處代表著堅強、自律與時刻準備，但絕不代表放棄。

New Words.句子: Many people with type 2 diabetes can manage their condition through diet and exercise
New Words.中文: 許多2型糖尿病患者可以通過飲食和運動來管理他們的病情。

New Words.句子: The doctor advised her to lose weight to help control her type 2 diabetes
New Words.中文: 醫生建議她減輕體重，以幫助控制她的2型糖尿病。

New Words.句子: Draw a diagonal line to divide the square into two triangles
The carpenter measured the diagonal of the square to ensure that it was perfectly aligned
New Words.中文: 畫一條對角線將正方形分成兩個三角形

New Words.句子: The carpenter measured the length of the diagonal
New Words.中文: 木匠測量了對角線的長度

New Words.句子: The dictator ruled the country with an iron fist, punishing anyone who opposed him
New Words.中文: "獨裁者以鐵腕統治國家，懲罰任何反對他的人。"

New Words.句子: Many dictators have used propaganda to maintain their hold on power
New Words.中文: "許多獨裁者利用宣傳來維持對權力的控制。"

New Words.句子: The dictator's regime was marked by widespread human rights violations
New Words.中文: "該獨裁者的政權以廣泛的人權侵犯為特徵。"

New Words.句子: She gave a dignified speech at the ceremony
New Words.中文: "她在典禮上發表了莊重的演講。"

New Words.句子: In his new uniform, he looked handsome and carried himself with a dignified way of walking
New Words.中文: "穿著新制服，他看起來英俊，走路的姿態也顯得莊重。"

New Words.句子: The dignified manner in which he handled the situation impressed his colleagues
New Words.中文: "他處理這個情況的莊重方式給同事們留下了深刻的印象。"

New Words.句子: The teacher dignified each student's question, making them feel valued
New Words.中文: "老師尊重每個學生的問題，讓他們感到被重視。"

New Words.句子: She dignified her speech with a sense of calm and authority
New Words.中文: "她以冷靜和權威的態度使她的演講顯得更具莊重。"

New Words.句子: His actions dignified the occasion, adding a sense of solemnity
New Words.中文: "他的行為使這個場合更顯莊重，增添了一份莊嚴感。"

New Words.句子: He didn’t want to dignify the rumor with a response
New Words.中文: "他不想用回應來抬高這個謠言的地位。"

New Words.句子: By responding to the insult, she felt she was dignifying it unnecessarily
New Words.中文: "通過回應侮辱，她覺得自己不必要地抬高了它。"

New Words.句子: The artist refused to dignify the criticism, knowing it wasn’t worth acknowledging
New Words.中文: "藝術家拒絕對批評做出回應，知道這並不值得去理會。"

New Words.句子: His dignity was evident in the way he handled the difficult situation without losing his composure
New Words.中文: "他的尊嚴在於他處理困難情況的方式，始終保持冷靜。"

New Words.句子: She spoke with dignity, despite the challenges she faced
New Words.中文: "儘管面臨挑戰，她仍然以尊嚴發言。"

New Words.句子: The dignity of the occasion was reflected in the respectful behavior of the guests
New Words.中文: "這個場合的尊嚴體現在賓客們的尊重行為中。"

New Words.句子: The elderly man carried himself with great dignity throughout his life
New Words.中文: "那位老人一生都以極大的尊嚴自處。"

New Words.句子: The community showed dignity and respect for the fallen heroes
New Words.中文: "社區對逝去的英雄表現出尊嚴和敬意。"

New Words.句子: He regained his dignity after overcoming the hardships
New Words.中文: "他克服困難後重獲尊嚴。"

New Words.句子: You need to dilute the paint with water before using it
New Words.中文: "在使用之前，你需要將油漆用水稀釋。"

New Words.句子: The doctor advised her to dilute the medication with juice for easier consumption
New Words.中文: "醫生建議她將藥物與果汁混合，以便更容易服用。"

New Words.句子: The new regulations may dilute the impact of the original policy
New Words.中文: "新規定可能會削弱原政策的影響。"

New Words.句子: The hiring of the new CEO diluted the power of the company's president
New Words.中文: "新 CEO 的聘用削弱了公司總裁的權力。"

New Words.句子: Diluting the quality of our products could harm our brand reputation
New Words.中文: "稀釋我們產品的質量可能會損害我們的品牌聲譽。"

New Words.句子: The laboratory prepared a dilute solution for the experiment
New Words.中文: "實驗室為實驗準備了一種稀釋溶液。"

New Words.句子: The dilute mixture was easy to spread over the surface
New Words.中文: "這種稀釋混合物容易塗抹在表面上。"

New Words.句子: He dimmed the lights in the room to create a cozy atmosphere
New Words.中文: 他調暗了房間的燈光，營造出一種舒適的氛圍。

New Words.句子: He dimmed the lights in the theater before the movie started
New Words.中文: 在電影開始之前，他把劇院的燈光調暗了。

New Words.句子: The dim light in the room made it difficult to read
New Words.中文: 房間裡昏暗的光線讓閱讀變得困難。

New Words.句子: His memory of the event was dim after so many years
New Words.中文: 經過這麼多年，他對那件事的記憶變得模糊了。

New Words.句子: Her chances of success seemed dim after the recent setbacks
New Words.中文: 經過最近的挫折後，她的成功機會似乎渺茫。

New Words.句子: Carbon dioxide (CO₂) is released when fossil fuels are burned
New Words.中文: "當化石燃料燃燒時，二氧化碳（CO₂）會被釋放出來。"

New Words.句子: Nitrogen dioxide (NO₂) is a pollutant that contributes to smog formation
New Words.中文: "二氧化氮（NO₂）是一種污染物，會促進煙霧的形成。"

New Words.句子: The production of dioxide gases in industrial processes needs to be carefully regulated to prevent environmental damage
New Words.中文: "工業過程中二氧化物氣體的產生需要嚴格監管，以防止環境損害。"

New Words.句子: The hurricane had disastrous effects on the coastal town, leaving thousands homeless
New Words.中文: 颶風對沿海小鎮造成了災難性的影響，讓數千人無家可歸。

New Words.句子: The company’s disastrous decision led to the loss of many jobs
New Words.中文: 公司的災難性決策導致了許多工作崗位的流失。

New Words.句子: His disastrous mistake during the presentation cost the team the deal
New Words.中文: 他在報告中的災難性錯誤讓團隊失去了這筆交易。

New Words.句子: The teacher took disciplinary action against the student for breaking the school rules
New Words.中文: 老師對違反校規的學生採取了紀律處分。

New Words.句子: The company has a disciplinary procedure for employees who violate policies
New Words.中文: 公司對違反政策的員工有紀律處分程序。

New Words.句子: The disciplinary committee reviewed the case and decided to suspend the employee
New Words.中文: 紀律委員會審查了此案並決定暫停該員工的職位。

New Words.句子: The accountant found a discrepancy in the financial statements that needed to be addressed
New Words.中文: 會計發現財務報表中有不一致之處，需要加以處理。

New Words.句子: There was a discrepancy between the reported and actual sales figures
New Words.中文: 報告的銷售數字與實際銷售數字之間存在不一致。

New Words.句子: There were discrepancies between their accounts of the accident
New Words.中文: 他們對事故的敘述存在不一致之處。

New Words.句子: The detective noticed a discrepancy in the witness’s statements
New Words.中文: 偵探注意到目擊者的陳述中存在不一致之處。

New Words.句子: The study revealed a discrepancy between the expected outcomes and the actual results
New Words.中文: 研究顯示預期結果與實際結果之間存在差異。

New Words.句子: The engineer reported a discrepancy in the measurements of the prototype
New Words.中文: 工程師報告了原型測量數據中的不一致。

New Words.句子: He wore a disguise to avoid being recognized by fans
New Words.中文: 他戴上偽裝以避免被粉絲認出。

New Words.句子: Her clever disguise made it difficult for anyone to recognize her at the party
New Words.中文: 她巧妙的偽裝讓任何人在派對上都很難認出她。

New Words.句子: The spy disguised himself as a delivery person to gain entry to the building
New Words.中文: 那名間諜把自己偽裝成送貨員，以便進入大樓。

New Words.句子: She tried to disguise her disappointment with a smile
New Words.中文: 她試圖用微笑掩飾自己的失望。

New Words.句子: He disguised his handwriting to keep his identity secret
New Words.中文: 他偽裝了自己的字跡以保護身份不被揭露。

New Words.句子: The plane would probably disintegrate at that high speed
New Words.中文: 飛機在那麼高的速度下可能會解體。

New Words.句子: The neglected bridge began to disintegrate, with pieces of concrete falling into the river below
New Words.中文: 被忽視的橋樑開始解體，混凝土塊掉入下方的河流中。

New Words.句子: The company decided to dismiss the employee due to repeated violations of company policy
New Words.中文: 公司決定解雇該員工，因為他多次違反公司政策。

New Words.句子: The manager dismissed the worker after several warnings about tardiness
New Words.中文: 經過多次對遲到的警告後，經理開除了那位員工。

New Words.句子: She dismissed his concerns as minor and not worth worrying about
New Words.中文: 她把他的擔憂當作小事，覺得不值得擔心。

New Words.句子: The committee dismissed the proposal after finding it lacked practical feasibility
New Words.中文: 委員會認為該提案缺乏實際可行性，因此予以駁回。

New Words.句子: The judge dismissed the case for lack of evidence
New Words.中文: 法官因證據不足而駁回了此案。

New Words.句子: The professor dismissed the class after the lecture was over
New Words.中文: 教授在講課結束後宣布下課。

New Words.句子: The judge dismissed the court session until the following week
New Words.中文: 法官宣布休庭，延至下週再開庭。

New Words.句子: The company faced backlash after the wrongful dismissal of several employees
New Words.中文: 公司在錯誤解雇多名員工後遭遇了強烈反彈。

New Words.句子: He appealed the decision after receiving a dismissal notice from his employer
New Words.中文: 在收到雇主的解雇通知後，他對該決定提出了上訴。

New Words.句子: His suggestions were met with immediate dismissal by the committee
New Words.中文: 他的建議立即遭到委員會的駁回。

New Words.句子: The judge ruled in favor of the dismissal of the case due to lack of evidence
New Words.中文: 法官因證據不足裁定撤銷此案。

New Words.句子: I was surprised by his dismissal of the idea
New Words.中文: 我對他駁回這個想法感到驚訝。

New Words.句子: The strong winds displaced the picnic table across the yard
New Words.中文: 強風把野餐桌吹到院子的另一邊。

New Words.句子: After the merger, the company's headquarters were displaced to a larger office downtown
New Words.中文: 合併之後，公司的總部被遷移到市中心一間更大的辦公室。

New Words.句子: The new technology displaced the old way of communicating
New Words.中文: 新科技取代了舊有的溝通方式。

New Words.句子: AI technologies may displace people's jobs in the future
New Words.中文: 人工智慧技術未來可能會取代人們的工作。

New Words.句子: The young actor displaced the veteran star as the lead role in the play
New Words.中文: 這位年輕演員取代了資深明星，成為了劇中的主角。

New Words.句子: The construction project displaced several families from their homes
New Words.中文: 這個建設項目將幾個家庭迫遷出他們的家園。

New Words.句子: The wildfire displaced many animals from their habitats
New Words.中文: 野火將許多動物從它們的棲息地驅逐了出去。

New Words.句子: The displaced furniture cluttered the living room after the renovation
New Words.中文: 翻新後，移動的家具堆滿了客廳。

New Words.句子: Many displaced families sought shelter in temporary camps after the earthquake
New Words.中文: 地震後，許多流離失所的家庭在臨時營地尋求庇護。

New Words.句子: Displaced wildlife often struggle to adapt to new environments
New Words.中文: 流離失所的野生動物常常難以適應新環境。

New Words.句子: The displeasing smell of rotten food filled the kitchen
New Words.中文: (腐爛食物令人不悅的氣味充滿了整個廚房。)

New Words.句子: His displeasing attitude made it hard for others to enjoy the meeting
New Words.中文: (他令人不悅的態度讓其他人很難享受這次會議。)

New Words.句子: The displeasing color of the walls made the room feel smaller
New Words.中文: (牆壁令人不悅的顏色讓房間感覺更小。)

New Words.句子: The artist’s use of harsh contrasts created a displeasing effect
New Words.中文: (藝術家對強烈對比的運用產生了令人不悅的效果。)

New Words.句子: The dispute between the two companies over the contract terms was resolved in court
New Words.中文: 兩家公司關於合約條款的爭議在法庭上得到了解決。

New Words.句子: There was a heated dispute among the team members about the project's direction
New Words.中文: 團隊成員之間就專案方向展開了激烈的爭論。

New Words.句子: The territorial dispute between the neighboring countries has been ongoing for decades
New Words.中文: 鄰國之間的領土爭議已經持續了數十年。

New Words.句子: The labor dispute between the union and management led to a strike
New Words.中文: 工會與管理層之間的勞資爭議導致了罷工。

New Words.句子: They disputed the results of the survey, claiming it was inaccurate
New Words.中文: 他們對調查結果提出爭議，聲稱結果不準確。

New Words.句子: The couple disputed where to spend the holiday
New Words.中文: 這對夫妻爭論著該去哪裡度假。

New Words.句子: The defendant disputed the charges brought against them in court
New Words.中文: 被告在法庭上對所提出的指控提出異議。

New Words.句子: She disputed the accuracy of the report and requested a revision
New Words.中文: 她對報告的準確性提出異議並要求修訂。

New Words.句子: They disputed the election results
New Words.中文: 他們對選舉結果提出異議。

New Words.句子: The storm caused a severe disruption in electricity supply
New Words.中文: 暴風雨嚴重中斷了電力供應。

New Words.句子: Construction work led to a disruption in traffic flow during peak hours
New Words.中文: 施工導致尖峰時段交通流量中斷。

New Words.句子: The company faced significant disruptions in production due to equipment failure
New Words.中文: 由於設備故障，公司生產遭遇了重大中斷。

New Words.句子: The rise of streaming services caused a disruption in the traditional cable TV industry
New Words.中文: 串流服務的興起對傳統有線電視產業造成了衝擊。

New Words.句子: Smartphones have created a disruption in how people communicate and access information
New Words.中文: 智慧型手機徹底改變了人們溝通和獲取資訊的方式。

New Words.句子: The startup’s innovative business model led to a disruption in the retail sector
New Words.中文: 這家新創公司的創新商業模式對零售業造成了顛覆。

New Words.句子: Sugar dissolves quickly in hot water
New Words.中文: 糖在熱水中很快溶解。

New Words.句子: She stirred the tea until the honey dissolved completely
New Words.中文: 她攪拌茶水，直到蜂蜜完全溶解。

New Words.句子: The company was dissolved after years of financial struggles
New Words.中文: 該公司在多年的財務困境後被解散。

New Words.句子: The board voted to dissolve the committee after it completed its work
New Words.中文: 董事會在委員會完成工作後投票決定解散該委員會。

New Words.句子: The audience dissolved into tears during the play's final scene
New Words.中文: 在劇本的最後一幕中，觀眾忍不住淚流滿面。

New Words.句子: The children dissolved into laughter during the funny part of the movie
New Words.中文: 在電影的搞笑片段中，孩子們忍不住笑了起來。

New Words.句子: The distant view of the mountains was breathtaking as the sun set behind them
New Words.中文: (遠處的群山景色隨著夕陽西下而令人驚嘆。)

New Words.句子: From the hill, we had a distant view of the entire valley
New Words.中文: (從山丘上，我們可以遠望整個山谷。)

New Words.句子: The whiskey is distilled to achieve a smooth flavor
New Words.中文: 威士忌經過蒸餾處理，以達到順口的風味。

New Words.句子: They distilled the seawater to produce drinkable water
New Words.中文: 他們將海水進行蒸餾處理，製造出可飲用的水。

New Words.句子: She distilled the complex report into a few clear points for the team
New Words.中文: 她將複雜的報告精煉成幾個簡明的要點，提供給團隊。

New Words.句子: The novel distills the essence of life in a small town
New Words.中文: 這部小說提煉了小鎮生活的精髓。

New Words.句子: There is a clear distinction between classical music and jazz
New Words.中文: 古典音樂與爵士音樂之間有明顯的區別。

New Words.句子: The distinction between a hobby and a career is important for personal growth
New Words.中文: 區分興趣與職業對個人成長非常重要。

New Words.句子: She received the distinction of being named the best student of the year
New Words.中文: 她獲得了被評為年度最佳學生的殊榮。

New Words.句子: The company earned the distinction of having the best customer service in the industry
New Words.中文: 該公司獲得了擁有業界最佳客戶服務的殊榮。

New Words.句子: His ability to make distinctions between similar ideas helped clarify the discussion
New Words.中文: 他能夠區分相似觀點的能力幫助澄清了討論。

New Words.句子: The distinction between fact and opinion is crucial for critical thinking
New Words.中文: 事實與觀點之間的區別對於批判性思維至關重要。

New Words.句子: The constant noise outside was a major distraction while studying
New Words.中文: 外面不斷的噪音在學習時成為了主要的干擾。

New Words.句子: Social media can be a significant distraction during work hours
New Words.中文: 社交媒體在工作時間內可能是個重大的干擾源。

New Words.句子: He complained that there were not enough distractions in the town
New Words.中文: 他抱怨鎮上沒有足夠的娛樂活動。

New Words.句子: He struggled to concentrate due to his distraction over personal issues
New Words.中文: 由於個人問題的分心，他難以集中注意力。

New Words.句子: Her distraction during the meeting was noticeable to everyone
New Words.中文: 她在會議中的分心讓大家都注意到了。

New Words.句子: She was driven to distraction by the endless delays
New Words.中文: 她被無休止的延誤弄得心煩意亂。

New Words.句子: His distraction after hearing the bad news was evident in his behavior
New Words.中文: 他聽到壞消息後的分心在他的行為中表現得十分明顯。

New Words.句子: Please try not to disturb me while I'm studying
New Words.中文: 請在我學習時盡量不要打擾我。

New Words.句子: The news of the accident disturbed her deeply, and she couldn't concentrate on anything else
New Words.中文: 事故的消息讓她深受打擊，無法集中注意力做其他事情。

New Words.句子: The loud noises from the construction site disturbed my sleep
He was disturbed by the constant phone calls during his meeting
I don't want to disturb them while they're having dinner
The thought of the upcoming exam disturbed him so much that he couldn’t sleep
The argument with her friend disturbed her for the rest of the day
The loud noise from the construction site caused a disturbance in the neighborhood, disturbing residents' sleep
New Words.中文: 來自工地的噪音對社區造成了干擾，打擾了居民的睡眠。

New Words.句子: We can work here without disturbance
New Words.中文: 我們可以在這裡不受干擾地工作。

New Words.句子: The disturbance in the classroom was caused by the loud argument between two students
There was a disturbance outside the building, which led to the police being called
The hiking trail diverged into two paths, one leading towards the mountain peak and the other descending into the valley
New Words.中文: 登山小徑分岔成兩條路，一條通往山頂，另一條則通向山谷。

New Words.句子: The two friends' career paths began to diverge after college, with one pursuing a traditional corporate job and the other opting for entrepreneurship
New Words.中文: 這兩位朋友的大學畢業後，職業道路開始分歧，一位選擇了傳統的企業工作，另一位則選擇了創業。

New Words.句子: During the project development, the project members and the manager had diverging opinions on the design direction
New Words.中文: 在專案開發過程中，專案成員和經理對設計方向有著不同的看法。

New Words.句子: It's common for project members to diverge on the development direction, whether from a design perspective or a mechanical point of view
New Words.中文: 專案成員在開發方向上出現分歧是常見的，無論是從設計角度還是機械視角來看。

New Words.句子: The artist sketched a mesmerizing image of two concentric circles, depicting the divergence of lines extending outward from their shared center, creating a sense of depth and movement on the canvas
New Words.中文: 藝術家畫了一幅迷人的圖像，描繪了兩個同心圓，展示了從它們共同中心向外延伸的線條的分歧，營造出畫布上深度和運動感。

New Words.句子: Despite their long friendship, there was a clear divergence between them on the issue of climate change, with one advocating for immediate action while the other remained skeptical
New Words.中文: 儘管他們有著長久的友誼，但在氣候變遷問題上，兩人明顯存在分歧，一方主張立即採取行動，而另一方則保持懷疑態度。

New Words.句子: The board meeting ended in a deadlock, with significant divergence among members on the budget allocation for the upcoming fiscal year
New Words.中文: 董事會會議以僵局結束，成員們在下一財年預算分配問題上存在重大分歧。

New Words.句子: The company prides itself on its diverse workforce, with employees from many different cultural backgrounds and skill sets
New Words.中文: 該公司以其多元化的員工隊伍為榮，員工來自不同的文化背景，擁有各種不同的技能組合。

New Words.句子: The magazine covers topics as diverse as chemistry and sculpture
New Words.中文: 這本雜誌涵蓋了從化學到雕塑等各種不同的主題。

New Words.句子: The diversity of opinions among the office led to a more comprehensive understanding of the issues at hand and inspired creative solutions
New Words.中文: 辦公室中意見的多樣性促進了對當前問題的更全面理解，並激發了創新的解決方案。

New Words.句子: The company values diversity in its workforce, believing that different perspectives lead to better decision-making
New Words.中文: 公司重視員工的多樣性，相信不同的觀點能夠促進更好的決策。

New Words.句子: Diversity is the strength that allows every voice to be heard.
New Words.中文: 多樣性是讓每個聲音被聽見的力量。

New Words.句子: Our diversity is not a weakness; it is our greatest strength.
New Words.中文: 我們的多樣性不是弱點，而是我們最強大的力量。

New Words.句子: In diversity, we find beauty and resilience.
New Words.中文: 在多樣性中，我們發現了美麗與堅韌。

New Words.句子: The company announced a quarterly dividend of $0
New Words.中文: 該公司宣布了每季0美元的股息。

New Words.句子: Investors were pleased to receive their dividends just before the holiday season
New Words.中文: 投資者們很高興在假期前收到他們的股息

New Words.句子: Reinvesting dividends can be a good strategy for long-term growth
New Words.中文: 再投資股息對於長期增長來說是一個不錯的策略。

New Words.句子: Eating healthy and exercising yields big dividends
New Words.中文: 保持健康飲食和運動會帶來豐厚的回報。

New Words.句子: In the equation 8 ÷ 2 = 4, eight is the dividend
New Words.中文: 在方程式 8 ÷ 2 = 4 中，8 是被除數（dividend）。

New Words.句子: The hard work put into the project paid off with dividends in the form of success and recognition
He dodged the first punch but was hit by the second
New Words.中文: 他躲過了第一拳，但被第二拳打中了。

New Words.句子: She dodged through the crowds as she hurried home
New Words.中文: 她匆匆回家時，在人群中穿梭閃避。

New Words.句子: We dodged between the cars as we raced across the street
New Words.中文: 我們在街道上奔跑時，穿梭於車輛之間閃避。

New Words.句子: She accused him of dodging his responsibilities as a parent
New Words.中文: 她指責他逃避作為父母的責任。

New Words.句子: He tried to dodge the reporters' queries
New Words.中文: 他試圖閃避記者的提問。

New Words.句子: It was just another dodge to get out of working
New Words.中文: 那只不過是又一次為了逃避工作的藉口。

New Words.句子: Those were the dodges he used to escape taxation
New Words.中文: 那些是他用來逃稅的手段。

New Words.句子: The professor is an expert in the domain of artificial intelligence
New Words.中文: 這位教授是人工智慧領域的專家。

New Words.句子: Music falls within her domain of expertise
New Words.中文: 音樂屬於她的專業領域。

New Words.句子: The castle was located within the king's domain
New Words.中文: 這座城堡位於國王的領地之內。

New Words.句子: The park is considered public domain and accessible to everyone
New Words.中文: 這座公園被視為公共領域，人人皆可進入使用。

New Words.句子: The company registered a new domain for its website
New Words.中文: 該公司為其網站註冊了一個新的網域名稱。

New Words.句子: The domain name for the website ends in "org"
New Words.中文: 該網站的網域名稱以 "org" 結尾。

New Words.句子: She handled all domestic chores, including cooking and cleaning
New Words.中文: 她處理所有家務，包括烹飪和清潔。

New Words.句子: The hotel offered domestic services such as laundry and housekeeping
New Words.中文: 酒店提供了家政服務，如洗衣和客房清潔。

New Words.句子: The government focuses on both domestic and international policies
New Words.中文: 政府專注於國內和國際政策。

New Words.句子: Domestic flights are usually cheaper than international ones
New Words.中文: 國內航班通常比國際航班便宜。

New Words.句子: Chickens and cows are common domestic animals on farms
New Words.中文: 雞和牛是農場上常見的家禽和家畜。

New Words.句子: Unlike wild cats, domestic cats are used to living with people
New Words.中文: 與野生貓不同，家養貓習慣了與人類一起生活。

New Words.句子: He became more domestic after having children
New Words.中文: 他在有了孩子後變得更加家庭化。

New Words.句子: She enjoys a quiet, domestic lifestyle
New Words.中文: 她享受安靜的家庭生活。

New Words.句子: The wealthy family employed several domestics to manage their large estate
New Words.中文: 這個富裕家庭聘用了幾位家政工人來管理他們的大莊園。

New Words.句子: Dogs and cats are among the most commonly domesticated animals
New Words.中文: （狗和貓是最常被馴養的動物之一。）

New Words.句子: The farm had several domesticated horses trained for riding
New Words.中文: （農場裡有幾匹馴養過的馬，訓練用於騎乘。）

New Words.句子: Over generations, wild plants have been domesticated to produce better crops
New Words.中文: （經過多代的選育，野生植物已經被馴化，用來生產更好的農作物。）

New Words.句子: He became more domesticated after getting married, helping with chores and cooking
New Words.中文: （結婚後，他變得更加家庭化，幫忙做家務和烹飪。）

New Words.句子: She never saw herself as the domesticated type, preferring travel over home life
New Words.中文: （她從未認為自己是那種家庭化的人，喜歡旅行勝過安定的家庭生活。）

New Words.句子: The seeds remain in a state of dormancy until the right environmental conditions trigger their germination
New Words.中文: 種子保持休眠狀態，直到適當的環境條件觸發其發芽。

New Words.句子: Many animals enter a state of dormancy during the winter months to conserve energy
New Words.中文: 許多動物在冬季進入休眠狀態以保存能量。

New Words.句子: The company's dormancy during the economic downturn allowed them to reevaluate their business strategy
New Words.中文: 在經濟衰退期間，該公司的停滯狀態使他們能夠重新評估其商業策略。

New Words.句子: The dormancy of the project was due to funding issues but is expected to resume next year
New Words.中文: 該專案因資金問題而處於停滯狀態，但預計將於明年恢復。

New Words.句子: The seeds remain dormant until the spring rains arrive
New Words.中文: 種子保持休眠，直到春雨到來。

New Words.句子: The volcano has been dormant for decades, but it could erupt again at any time
New Words.中文: 這座火山已經沉寂了數十年，但隨時可能再次爆發。

New Words.句子: Some individuals may seem dormant during difficult times, but they have the potential to thrive once their circumstances improve
New Words.中文: 有些人在困難時期可能看似沉寂，但一旦環境改善，他們便有潛力蓬勃發展。

New Words.句子: The project has been dormant for several months due to lack of funding
New Words.中文: 由於資金短缺，該專案已經停滯了好幾個月。

New Words.句子: The company has several dormant patents that they plan to revisit in the future
New Words.中文: 該公司擁有數項閒置的專利，計劃未來重新審視。

New Words.句子: After the merger, many of the divisions became dormant as the company reassessed its strategy
New Words.中文: 合併後，由於公司重新評估其策略，許多部門陷入了停滯狀態。

New Words.句子: The dotted lines on the map show the hiking trail
New Words.中文: (地圖上的虛線顯示了健行步道。)

New Words.句子: The dotted lines indicate where to cut the paper
New Words.中文: (虛線標示出剪紙的位置。)

New Words.句子: The dotted lines on the diagram highlight the areas requiring attention
New Words.中文: (圖表上的虛線突出了需要注意的區域。)

New Words.句子: The two departments dovetail their projects to ensure a seamless workflow
New Words.中文: 這兩個部門將他們的項目相互協調，以確保工作流程的順暢。

New Words.句子: Her goals dovetail perfectly with the company's mission
New Words.中文: 她的目標與公司的使命完美契合。

New Words.句子: The carpenter dovetailed the drawers to ensure a sturdy construction
New Words.中文: 木匠將抽屜的接合處做了榫接，以確保結構穩固。

New Words.句子: The cabinet’s dovetail joints enhance its durability and craftsmanship
New Words.中文: 這個櫥櫃的榫接工藝增強了其耐用性和工藝水平。

New Words.句子: The dovetail was skillfully crafted to create a perfect fit between the wooden panels
New Words.中文: 榫接工藝巧妙地製作，確保了木板之間的完美契合。

New Words.句子: She loves to draw portraits of her friends
New Words.中文: 她喜歡畫朋友們的肖像。

New Words.句子: She drew inspiration from nature for her design
New Words.中文: 她的設計靈感來自大自然。

New Words.句子: The draw of the rope was strong enough to pull the heavy object
New Words.中文: 這根繩索的拉力足夠將重物拉動。

New Words.句子: After the draw, the contestants waited to see who would win the prize
New Words.中文: 抽獎結束後，參賽者們等待著看誰將獲得獎品。

New Words.句子: The raffle draw determined the winner of the grand prize
New Words.中文: 抽獎決定了大獎的得主。

New Words.句子: The draw for the tournament was held yesterday
New Words.中文: 比賽的抽籤昨天舉行。

New Words.句子: The soccer match ended in a 1-1 draw
New Words.中文: 足球比賽以1比1平局結束。

New Words.句子: The chess game resulted in a draw after hours of play
New Words.中文: 這場棋局在經過數小時的對弈後以平局結束。

New Words.句子: The artist drew a beautiful landscape on the canvas
New Words.中文: 藝術家在畫布上畫了一幅美麗的風景。

New Words.句子: He drew the curtains to let in the sunlight
New Words.中文: 他拉開窗簾讓陽光進來。

New Words.句子: She drew the chair closer to the table
New Words.中文: 她把椅子拉近桌子。

New Words.句子: He drew water from the well using a bucket
New Words.中文: 他用水桶從井裡提水。

New Words.句子: The nurse drew blood for testing
New Words.中文: 護士抽血進行測試。

New Words.句子: The exhibition drew many visitors from around the world
New Words.中文: 這個展覽吸引了來自世界各地的許多參觀者。

New Words.句子: The new movie is expected to draw large audiences
New Words.中文: 這部新電影預計將吸引大量觀眾。

New Words.句子: From the data, they drew the conclusion that the experiment was a success
New Words.中文: 根據數據，他們得出結論，實驗是成功的。

New Words.句子: Every Monday morning, he dreaded the commute to work, knowing he would face heavy traffic and a long day ahead
New Words.中文: 每個星期一早晨，他都對上班的通勤感到恐懼，因為他知道將面對繁忙的交通和漫長的一天。

New Words.句子: She dreaded having to confront her boss about the mistake
New Words.中文: 她害怕不得不面對老闆談論那個錯誤。

New Words.句子: He felt a sense of dread before the final exam
New Words.中文: 在期末考試前，他感到一種恐懼感。

New Words.句子: The deepening shadows in the forest filled him with a sense of dread, as he knew the legends of what lurked within
New Words.中文: 森林中日漸加深的陰影讓他感到一種恐懼感，因為他知道有關森林中潛伏之物的傳說。

New Words.句子: The landscape at sunrise looked dreamlike, with soft, golden light bathing the entire scene
New Words.中文: 日出時的景色如夢似幻，柔和的金色光芒照亮了整個畫面。

New Words.句子: The movie had a dreamlike quality, blurring the lines between reality and fantasy
New Words.中文: 這部電影具有夢幻般的質感，模糊了現實與幻想之間的界線。

New Words.句子: The quiet, dreamlike atmosphere of the beach at dusk made it feel like time had stopped
New Words.中文: 黃昏時分，海灘的寧靜與夢幻氛圍讓人感覺時間仿佛停止了。

New Words.句子: Her dreamlike smile made everything around her seem peaceful
New Words.中文: 她夢幻般的微笑讓她周圍的一切都顯得平靜。

New Words.句子: He used a drill to bore holes in the wooden plank
New Words.中文: 他使用電鑽在木板上鑽洞。

New Words.句子: The fire department conducted a fire drill to practice evacuation procedures
New Words.中文: 消防隊進行了一次消防演習，以練習疏散程序。

New Words.句子: He drilled holes in the wall to hang the shelves
New Words.中文: 他在牆上鑽了洞來掛置架子。

New Words.句子: The sergeant drilled the recruits on rifle assembly and disassembly
New Words.中文: 軍士長對新兵進行了步槍組裝和拆卸的訓練。

New Words.句子: The carpenter needed a powerful drill to work with the thick metal
The students participated in a safety drill to prepare for potential earthquakes
She drilled into the concrete to install the heavy-duty hooks
The coach drilled the team on their passing techniques before the big game
The drone flew over the field, capturing aerial footage
New Words.中文: (無人機飛越田野，拍攝了空中畫面。)

New Words.句子: The teacher droned on, and the students grew restless
New Words.中文: (老師滔滔不絕地講著，學生們變得不安。)

New Words.句子: Drones are commonly used for delivering packages in some regions
New Words.中文: (無人機在某些地區常被用來送貨。)

New Words.句子: The drone bee had no other role in the hive but to mate with the queen
New Words.中文: (雄蜂的唯一角色是與蜂后交配。)

New Words.句子: Drones are larger than worker bees but have no stinger
New Words.中文: (雄蜂比工蜂大，但沒有刺針。)

New Words.句子: The drone of the old refrigerator could be heard in the background
New Words.中文: (那台舊冰箱的嗡嗡聲可以在背景中聽到。)

New Words.句子: The drone of the engine signaled that the plane was about to land
New Words.中文: (引擎的嗡嗡聲表示飛機即將降落。)

New Words.句子: The speaker droned on for hours, losing the audience's attention
New Words.中文: (演講者喋喋不休地講了好幾個小時，讓聽眾失去了注意力。)

New Words.句子: The airplane droned overhead as it approached the runway
New Words.中文: (飛機在頭頂上嗡嗡作響，接近跑道。)

New Words.句子: He droned about his day without any enthusiasm
New Words.中文: (他沒有任何熱情地喋喋不休地講述自己的一天。)

New Words.句子: There was a significant drop-off in sales after the holiday season ended
New Words.中文: 假期結束後，銷售量顯著下降。

New Words.句子: The school has a drop-off zone for parents to leave their children in the morning
New Words.中文: 學校設有一個接送區，供家長早上將孩子送下車。

New Words.句子: The hikers were cautious near the cliff's edge due to the sharp drop-off
New Words.中文: 由於懸崖邊緣的急劇下降，登山者在靠近那裡時非常小心。

New Words.句子: She dropped off the package at the post office on her way to work
New Words.中文: 她在上班途中將包裹放在郵局。

New Words.句子: I will be dropping off my kids at school before heading to the meeting
New Words.中文: 我會在去開會之前先把孩子送到學校。

New Words.句子: Attendance at the event dropped off significantly after the keynote speaker finished
New Words.中文: 在主題演講者結束後，活動的出席人數顯著下降。

New Words.句子: The number of visitors to the museum has been dropping off since the start of winter
New Words.中文: 自從冬季開始以來，博物館的參觀人數一直在下降。

New Words.句子: The country's economic problems are largely due to the weakness of the recovery
New Words.中文: 該國的經濟問題主要是由於復甦的疲弱所造成的。

New Words.句子: Her success was due to years of hard work and determination
New Words.中文: 她的成功歸功於多年的努力工作和決心。

New Words.句子: The results are due at the end of the month
New Words.中文: 結果將在月底公布。

New Words.句子: We are due to leave tomorrow
New Words.中文: 我們預計明天離開。

New Words.句子: I hope people will use the footpaths and treat them with due attention
New Words.中文: 我希望人們能夠使用人行道並給予它應有的重視。

New Words.句子: He handled it with due care and diligence
New Words.中文: 他以應有的謹慎和勤勉處理了這件事。

New Words.句子: That money is due to me, but I haven't received it yet
New Words.中文: 那筆錢應該是我的，但我還沒收到。

New Words.句子: He finally received the recognition that was due to him
New Words.中文: 他終於獲得了應該屬於他的認可。

New Words.句子: The duration of the movie was over two hours
New Words.中文: 電影的長度超過了兩個小時。

New Words.句子: He stayed in the hospital for the duration of his treatment
New Words.中文: 在治療期間，他一直住在醫院。

New Words.句子: The contract is valid for the duration of one year
New Words.中文: 這份合約有效期為一年。

New Words.句子: The teacher extended the duration of the exam by 30 minutes
New Words.中文: 老師將考試的時間延長了30分鐘。

New Words.句子: The children played outside until dusk, when the sky turned shades of orange and purple
New Words.中文: 孩子們在外面玩耍直到黃昏，當時天空變成了橙色和紫色的色調。

New Words.句子: The hikers hurried to set up their tent before dusk fell
New Words.中文: 登山者匆忙搭起帳篷，趕在黃昏降臨之前。

New Words.句子: At dusk, the streetlights began to flicker on, casting a soft glow on the quiet street
New Words.中文: 黃昏時，街燈開始閃爍，將柔和的光芒投射在寧靜的街道上。

New Words.句子: She eavesdropped on her neighbors' conversation to find out more about the party
New Words.中文: 她偷聽了鄰居的對話，以了解更多關於派對的訊息。

New Words.句子: He was caught eavesdropping outside the door during the meeting
New Words.中文: 他在會議期間被發現偷聽門外。

New Words.句子: Eavesdropping on their discussion gave her insights into the project
New Words.中文: 偷聽他們的討論讓她對這個項目有了深入的了解。

New Words.句子: They were eavesdropping on a private conversation at the café when they heard their names mentioned
New Words.中文: 他們在咖啡館偷聽一場私人對話時，聽到了提到他們的名字。

New Words.句子: While waiting in the hallway, she unintentionally eavesdropped on a conversation about the upcoming changes in management
New Words.中文: 在走廊等待時，她無意中偷聽到了關於即將變動的管理層的對話。

New Words.句子: Her eccentricity was evident in her unique fashion sense and creative ideas
New Words.中文: 她的古怪個性表現在她獨特的穿著風格和創意十足的點子中。

New Words.句子: The inventor's eccentricity often led to groundbreaking innovations
New Words.中文: 這位發明家的古怪個性常常促成了開創性的創新。

New Words.句子: The eccentricity of the comet's orbit makes it difficult to predict its path
New Words.中文: 彗星軌道的古怪形狀使得預測其路徑變得困難。

New Words.句子: His colleagues admired his eccentricity, seeing it as a sign of his genius
New Words.中文: 他的同事們欣賞他的古怪個性，認為這是他天才的象徵。

New Words.句子: The echo of her footsteps reverberated through the empty hallway
New Words.中文: 她的腳步聲在空蕩蕩的走廊中回響。

New Words.句子: The conversation had an echo of their earlier disagreements, making it difficult to find common ground
New Words.中文: 談話中帶有他們早先分歧的回響，使得尋找共同點變得困難。

New Words.句子: She's just an echo of her famous mother, repeating her lines and gestures without adding anything new
New Words.中文: 她只是她著名母親的回聲，重複著她母親的台詞和姿勢，沒有帶來任何新意。

New Words.句子: She echoed his sentiments about the importance of teamwork
New Words.中文: 她附和了他關於團隊合作重要性的看法。

New Words.句子: He is always echoing what his boss says
New Words.中文: 他總是附和他老闆說的話。

New Words.句子: The mountain echoed his shouts as he called for help
New Words.中文: 山谷回響著他求救的呼喊。

New Words.句子: We shouted into the cave and heard our voices echo back
His speech carried echoes of his predecessor’s policy promises
His views are merely an echo of his mentor’s opinions
The new software improved the efficiency of the office by automating routine tasks
New Words.中文: 新軟體通過自動化日常任務提高了辦公室的效率。

New Words.句子: She is known for her efficiency in managing multiple projects at once
New Words.中文: 她以高效管理多個項目而聞名。

New Words.句子: The efficiency of the engine was increased by reducing friction and improving fuel consumption
New Words.中文: 通過減少摩擦和改善燃油消耗，引擎的效率得到了提高。

New Words.句子: Solar panels have become more efficient, capturing more energy from the sun
New Words.中文: 太陽能板變得更加高效，能夠從太陽捕獲更多的能源。

New Words.句子: The civilization of ancient Egypt made significant advancements in writing, medicine, and engineering
New Words.中文: 古埃及文明在書寫、醫學和工程方面取得了重大的進展。

New Words.句子: Tourists from around the world visit Egypt to explore its famous archaeological sites and cultural heritage
New Words.中文: 來自世界各地的遊客造訪埃及，探索其著名的考古遺址和文化遺產。

New Words.句子: The Great Pyramid of Giza, one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World, is a symbol of Egypt's enduring legacy
New Words.中文: 吉薩大金字塔，古代七大奇蹟之一，是埃及持久遺產的象徵。

New Words.句子: The museum displayed Egyptian artifacts from the time of the pharaohs
New Words.中文: 博物館展示了來自法老時代的埃及文物。

New Words.句子: She met an Egyptian who shared stories about life in Cairo
New Words.中文: 她遇到了一位埃及人，分享了關於開羅生活的故事。

New Words.句子: Scholars have been studying Egyptian for decades to understand ancient texts
New Words.中文: 學者們已經研究埃及語數十年，以理解古代的文本。

New Words.句子: The architect presented an elaborate design for the new museum, complete with intricate patterns, innovative materials, and carefully planned exhibition spaces
New Words.中文: 建築師提出了新博物館的精緻設計，內含複雜的圖案、創新的材料和精心規劃的展覽空間。

New Words.句子: They made elaborate preparations for his visit
New Words.中文: 他們為他的訪問做了精心的準備。

New Words.句子: I see now that her behavior was all part of an elaborate (plan/plot/scheme)
New Words.中文: 我現在明白了，她的行為完全是精心策劃的一部分。

New Words.句子: I'll be glad to elaborate if you want to hear more
New Words.中文: 如果你想聽更多，我很樂意詳細說明。

New Words.句子: During the meeting, the team members elaborated on their ideas for the upcoming project, discussing potential strategies, timelines, and resource allocations
New Words.中文: 在會議中，團隊成員詳細闡述了他們對即將到來的項目的想法，討論了潛在的策略、時間表和資源分配。

New Words.句子: Some of these points will be elaborated in the following chapter
New Words.中文: 其中一些要點將在接下來的章節中詳細說明。

New Words.句子: The elf helped Santa Claus prepare gifts for children
New Words.中文: 精靈幫助聖誕老人為孩子們準備禮物。

New Words.句子: In the story, an elf granted the traveler three wishes
New Words.中文: 在故事中，一個精靈給了旅行者三個願望。

New Words.句子: The forest was said to be home to mysterious elves
New Words.中文: 據說這片森林是神秘精靈的家園。

New Words.句子: Her child was like a little elf, always getting into trouble
New Words.中文: 她的孩子像個小精靈，總是惹麻煩。

New Words.句子: With his quick movements and sly grin, he reminded her of an elf
New Words.中文: 他迅速的動作和狡猾的笑容讓她想起了一個精靈。

New Words.句子: After much questioning, he elicited the truth from the boy
New Words.中文: 經過反覆盤問，他從男孩那裡引出了真相。

New Words.句子: The artist's work aims to elicit deep emotions and reflection from viewers
New Words.中文: 這位藝術家的作品旨在引發觀眾的深刻情感和反思。

New Words.句子: Her speech was designed to elicit empathy from the audience for the plight of refugees
New Words.中文: 她的演講旨在引起觀眾對難民困境的同情。

New Words.句子: The orbits of planets around the sun are elliptical in shape
New Words.中文: 行星圍繞太陽的軌道呈橢圓形。

New Words.句子: The garden was designed with an ellipse in the center for a unique look
New Words.中文: 花園的設計以中央的橢圓形為特色，營造出獨特的外觀。

New Words.句子: In the sentence “She can play the guitar, and he, the piano,” the word “can” is omitted after “he” due to ellipsis
New Words.中文: 在句子“她會彈吉他，他（會彈）鋼琴”中，由於省略，"can" 在 "he" 後被省略。

New Words.句子: I went to the store, and she to the park" uses ellipsis to omit the repeated verb
New Words.中文: 「I went to the store, and she to the park」使用了省略（ellipsis）來省略重複的動詞。

New Words.句子: The design of the new stadium features an elliptical shape
New Words.中文: 新體育場的設計呈現出橢圓形狀。

New Words.句子: The elliptical orbit of the planet around the sun was observed by the scientists
New Words.中文: 行星圍繞太陽的橢圓軌道被科學家觀察到。

New Words.句子: The president’s elliptical remarks left many unsure of his exact stance on the issue
New Words.中文: 總統模稜兩可的言論讓許多人不確定他對這個問題的確切立場。

New Words.句子: The writer’s use of elliptical phrasing made the poem open to multiple interpretations
New Words.中文: 作家使用模稜兩可的措辭，使這首詩有多種解釋的可能性。

New Words.句子: She uses the elliptical at the gym to get a low-impact cardiovascular workout
New Words.中文: 她在健身房使用橢圓機進行低衝擊的心血管鍛煉。

New Words.句子: The new elliptical in the fitness center has various settings to adjust the intensity of the exercise
New Words.中文: 健身中心的新橢圓機有各種設置，可以調整運動的強度。

New Words.句子: The designer decided to elongate the sleeves to create a more dramatic look
New Words.中文: 設計師決定拉長袖子，以創造更具戲劇性的外觀。

New Words.句子: The road was elongated to connect the two cities
New Words.中文: 這條路被拉長以連接兩個城市。

New Words.句子: The meeting was elongated due to the number of discussions
New Words.中文: 會議因討論事項眾多而被延長。

New Words.句子: The scientist wanted to elongate the experiment to gather more data
New Words.中文: 科學家想延長實驗以收集更多數據。

New Words.句子: The elongated neck of the giraffe allowed it to reach the high leaves
New Words.中文: 長頸鹿拉長的脖子讓它能夠夠到高處的葉子。

New Words.句子: The building's elongated shape made it stand out against the skyline
New Words.中文: 建築物拉長的形狀使其在天空線中顯得突出。

New Words.句子: The artist drew an elongated circle to create a sense of movement in the piece
New Words.中文: 藝術家畫了一個拉長的圓形，以在作品中創造一種運動感。

New Words.句子: The elongation of the metal occurred when it was heated and pulled into a wire
New Words.中文: 金屬在被加熱並拉成線時發生了拉伸。

New Words.句子: The elongation of the road improved access to the new neighborhood
New Words.中文: 這條道路的延長改善了通往新社區的交通便利。

New Words.句子: The elongation of the muscles during the stretch helped improve flexibility
New Words.中文: 在伸展過程中肌肉的延展有助於提高柔韌性。

New Words.句子: The dotted lines indicate the elongation of the handlebar adjustment for people with different height requirements
New Words.中文: 虛線表示車把調整的延長，適用於不同身高需求的人。

New Words.句子: The elusive truth about the legend of the Loch Ness Monster continues to captivate the minds of researchers worldwide
New Words.中文: 關於尼斯湖水怪傳說的難以捉摸的真相繼續吸引著全球研究人員的注意。

New Words.句子: She pursued the elusive feeling of contentment, but it seemed to slip away every time she thought she had found it
New Words.中文: 關於尼斯湖水怪傳說的難以捉摸的真相繼續吸引著全球研究人員的注意。

New Words.句子: The meaning of her words remained elusively vague
New Words.中文: 她話語的意思依然難以捉摸，模糊不清。

New Words.句子: They decided to embark on a road trip across the country to explore new places
New Words.中文: 他們決定展開一次橫跨全國的公路旅行，探索新地方。

New Words.句子: She embarked on a new career path after years of working in finance
New Words.中文: 在多年從事金融工作後，她開始了新的職業道路。

New Words.句子: The passengers began to embark on the cruise ship, excited for the upcoming voyage
New Words.中文: 乘客們開始登上郵輪，對即將到來的航程感到興奮。

New Words.句子: She felt deep embarrassment when she forgot her speech in front of the audience
New Words.中文: 她在觀眾面前忘記演講時感到深深的尷尬。

New Words.句子: His voice cracked while speaking, and he turned red with embarrassment
New Words.中文: 他的聲音在講話時顫抖，因為尷尬而臉紅。

New Words.句子: Losing his wallet twice in one week was a source of great embarrassment for him
New Words.中文: 一週內丟失錢包兩次，對他來說是非常尷尬的事。

New Words.句子: The artist embedded tiny gems into the sculpture for added detail
New Words.中文: 藝術家將小寶石嵌入雕塑中，以增添細節。

New Words.句子: They embedded the microchip into the device to enhance its functionality
New Words.中文: 他們將微晶片嵌入裝置中，以增強其功能性。

New Words.句子: Microchips are embedded in many modern electronic devices for improved performance
New Words.中文: 許多現代電子設備中都嵌入了微晶片，以提升性能。

New Words.句子: Traditional values are embedded in our culture, influencing our behavior and beliefs
New Words.中文: 傳統價值觀深植於我們的文化中，影響著我們的行為和信仰。

New Words.句子: The blogger embedded a video to illustrate her point
New Words.中文: 博主嵌入了一個影片來說明她的觀點。

New Words.句子: You can embed images directly into your presentation slides
New Words.中文: 你可以將圖片直接嵌入到你的簡報幻燈片中。

New Words.句子: He tends to embellish his stories with fantastical details to make them more entertaining
New Words.中文: 他傾向於在故事中加入奇幻的細節，以使其更具娛樂性。

New Words.句子: The interior designer embellished the room with luxurious fabrics and elegant furnishings
New Words.中文: 室內設計師用奢華的布料和優雅的家具裝飾了房間。

New Words.句子: He tends to embellish his accomplishments, making them seem more impressive than they actually are
New Words.中文: 他傾向於美化自己的成就，使它們看起來比實際上更加令人印象深刻。

New Words.句子: The designer chose to embellish the product by adding texture to the plastic surface, effectively distinguishing different areas based on their function and creating a more detailed and visually appealing design
New Words.中文: 設計師選擇通過在塑料表面添加質感來美化產品，有效地根據功能區分不同區域，並創造出更具細節和視覺吸引力的設計。

New Words.句子: This painting is nearly perfect, but it may still need a final embellishment
New Words.中文: 這幅畫幾乎完美，但可能還需要最後的點綴。

New Words.句子: The storyteller added a touch of embellishment to the tale, weaving in colorful details and exaggerated anecdotes to captivate the audience
New Words.中文: 故事講述者為故事增添了一些修飾，編織進了生動的細節和誇張的轶事，以吸引觀眾的注意。

New Words.句子: The Statue of Liberty embodies the spirit of freedom and democracy
New Words.中文: (自由女神像體現了自由與民主的精神。)

New Words.句子: The sculpture embodies the artist's vision of peace
New Words.中文: (這座雕塑體現了藝術家對和平的願景。)

New Words.句子: The CEO embodies the company's values of innovation and excellence
New Words.中文: (首席執行官體現了公司創新和卓越的價值觀。)

New Words.句子: The treaty embodies the principles of mutual respect and cooperation between the two nations
New Words.中文: (這份條約體現了兩國之間相互尊重與合作的原則。)

New Words.句子: The architectural design embodies elements of both modern and traditional styles
New Words.中文: (這個建築設計體現了現代與傳統風格的元素。)

New Words.句子: The new software update embodies several user-requested features and improvements
New Words.中文: (這個新的軟體更新體現了多項用戶要求的功能和改進。)

New Words.句子: The company logo was embossed on the cover of the leather notebook
New Words.中文: 公司徽標被壓印在皮革筆記本的封面上。

New Words.句子: She loved the embossed flowers on the wedding invitations
New Words.中文: 她喜歡婚禮邀請函上壓印的花朵圖案。

New Words.句子: The book's title was embossed in gold lettering on the spine
New Words.中文: 書名以金色字母壓印在書脊上。

New Words.句子: The artist embossed her initials on the corner of the metal sculpture
New Words.中文: 藝術家在金屬雕塑的角落處壓印了她的首字母。

New Words.句子: His stationery was embossed with his initials
New Words.中文: 他的文具上壓印了他的首字母。

New Words.句子: The embossing on the leather journal cover made it look sophisticated and unique
New Words.中文: 皮革日記封面上的壓印使它看起來既精緻又獨特。

New Words.句子: The wedding invitations featured elegant embossing that gave them a luxurious feel
New Words.中文: 婚禮邀請函上精緻的壓印賦予了它們一種奢華的質感。

New Words.句子: Embossing turns the simplest paper into a work of art.
New Words.中文: 浮雕能把最簡單的紙張變成藝術品。

New Words.句子: True craftsmanship is found in the details, like the subtle art of embossing.
New Words.中文: 真正的工藝體現在細節中，就像浮雕這門精緻的藝術。

New Words.句子: Embossing a brand name onto a plastic surface creates a sleek, lasting impression without extra materials.
New Words.中文: 將品牌名稱以浮雕方式壓印在塑膠表面上，能打造出簡潔而持久的印象，且無需額外材料。

New Words.句子: They embraced each other warmly
New Words.中文: 他們熱情地擁抱對方。

New Words.句子: We should embrace diversity and celebrate our differences
New Words.中文: 我們應該擁抱多元性，並慶祝我們的差異。

New Words.句子: She gave him a warm embrace when he returned home
New Words.中文: 當他回家時，她給了他一個溫暖的擁抱。

New Words.句子: She embraced the opportunity to travel and explore new cultures
New Words.中文: 她欣然接受了旅遊和探索新文化的機會。

New Words.句子: The factory reduced its carbon emissions to meet environmental regulations
New Words.中文: 工廠減少了碳排放，以符合環境法規。

New Words.句子: The emission of greenhouse gases contributes to climate change
New Words.中文: 溫室氣體的排放導致了氣候變化。

New Words.句子: Scientists are studying the emission of light from distant stars
New Words.中文: 科學家們正在研究遠處星星發出的光。

New Words.句子: Vehicle emissions are a major cause of air pollution
New Words.中文: 車輛排放是空氣污染的主要原因之一。

New Words.句子: The emission of toxic fumes forced the evacuation of the building
New Words.中文: 有毒氣體的排放迫使大樓內的人員撤離。

New Words.句子: The chimney emits smoke into the air
New Words.中文: 煙囪將煙霧排放到空氣中。

New Words.句子: The sun emits light and heat to sustain life on Earth
New Words.中文: 太陽發出光和熱來維持地球上的生命。

New Words.句子: The machine emitted a loud noise when it started
New Words.中文: 機器啟動時發出巨大的噪音。

New Words.句子: He emitted a sigh of relief after hearing the good news
New Words.中文: 聽到好消息後，他鬆了一口氣。

New Words.句子: The baby emitted a high-pitched cry in the middle of the night
New Words.中文: 嬰兒在半夜發出尖銳的哭聲。

New Words.句子: The teacher placed emphasis on the importance of studying for the final exam
New Words.中文: 老師強調了準備期末考的重要性。

New Words.句子: The emphasis in her speech was on the need for environmental conservation
New Words.中文: 她演講中的重點是強調環境保護的必要性。

New Words.句子: The word "definitely" was said with extra emphasis to show certainty
New Words.中文: 「definitely」這個詞被特別加強語氣來表達確定性。

New Words.句子: The speaker used emphasis to underline the main points of her argument
New Words.中文: 講者使用強調來突顯她論點的主要觀點。

New Words.句子: The new software will enable the team to collaborate more efficiently
New Words.中文: (這個新的軟體將使團隊能夠更高效地協作。)

New Words.句子: Her support enabled him to complete the project on time
New Words.中文: (她的支持使他能夠按時完成這個項目。)

New Words.句子: You need to enable Bluetooth on your phone to connect to the speaker
New Words.中文: (你需要在手機上啟用藍牙才能連接到揚聲器。)

New Words.句子: The technician enabled the new feature on the device remotely
New Words.中文: (技術員遠程啟用了設備上的新功能。)

New Words.句子: People are encroaching on the animal's habitat
New Words.中文: 人們正在侵佔動物的棲息地。

New Words.句子: He argues that the law would encroach upon states' authority
New Words.中文: 他爭辯說，這項法律將會侵犯各州的權力。

New Words.句子: The new company is encroaching on their traditional market
New Words.中文: 新公司正在侵入他們的傳統市場。

New Words.句子: The construction project encroached on the neighboring property, leading to a dispute between the homeowners
New Words.中文: 建築項目侵佔了旁邊的財產，導致房主之間發生爭執。

New Words.句子: The ocean is slowly encroaching upon the shoreline
The encroachment of urban development into rural areas threatens the natural landscape and wildlife habitats
New Words.中文: 城市開發對鄉村地區的侵占威脅到自然景觀和野生動物棲息地。

New Words.句子: I'm becoming increasingly frustrated by the encroachments on my personal space in the crowded subway during rush hour
New Words.中文: 在尖峰時段擁擠的地鐵裡，我對個人空間被侵犯感到越來越沮喪。

New Words.句子: The encroachment of human activity threatens the delicate balance of the natural world.
New Words.中文: 人類活動的侵占正在威脅自然界脆弱的平衡。

New Words.句子: Innovation must progress without the encroachment on personal freedom.
New Words.中文: 創新必須在不侵害個人自由的前提下推進。

New Words.句子: Her kindness and sincerity endeared her to everyone she met
New Words.中文: 她的善良和真誠使她受到每個遇見她的人的喜愛。

New Words.句子: He endeared himself by acts of generosity
New Words.中文: 他通過慷慨的行為贏得了人們的喜愛。

New Words.句子: She is always wearing an endearing smile
New Words.中文: 她總是帶著迷人的微笑。

New Words.句子: What’s most endearing is the simple act of kindness shared between people.
New Words.中文: 最令人感動的是人們之間那份簡單的善意。

New Words.句子: Authenticity is the most endearing quality a person can have.
New Words.中文: 真誠是人們最具吸引力的特質。

New Words.句子: His endeavor to start a new business was met with success
New Words.中文: 他創業的努力獲得了成功。

New Words.句子: Scientific endeavors have led to major medical breakthroughs
New Words.中文: 科學上的努力促成了重大的醫學突破。

New Words.句子: She put great effort into her artistic endeavor
New Words.中文: 她為她的藝術創作付出了極大的努力。

New Words.句子: He endeavored to complete the project before the deadline
New Words.中文: 他努力在截止日期前完成這個項目。

New Words.句子: The team is endeavoring to improve customer satisfaction
New Words.中文: 團隊正努力提升顧客滿意度。

New Words.句子: She endeavored to learn a new language within a year
New Words.中文: 她努力在一年內學會一門新語言。

New Words.句子: She was endowed with a remarkable talent for music
New Words.中文: 她被賦予了驚人的音樂天賦。

New Words.句子: The scholarship endows students with the opportunity to pursue higher education
New Words.中文: 這項獎學金為學生提供了追求高等教育的機會。

New Words.句子: Many believe that nature endows each individual with unique strengths and weaknesses
New Words.中文: 許多人相信大自然賦予每個人獨特的长處與弱點。
