New Words.句子: The wealthy donor decided to endow the university with funds to build a new research center
New Words.中文: 這位富有的捐贈者決定為大學提供資金，以建造一個新的研究中心。

New Words.句子: The foundation was established to endow various charitable initiatives across the community
New Words.中文: 這個基金會的設立是為了資助社區內的各種慈善活動。

New Words.句子: She was so engrossed in her book that she didn’t hear the phone ring
New Words.中文: 她如此專心於書本，以至於沒有聽到電話鈴聲。

New Words.句子: He sat engrossed in thought, unaware of his surroundings
New Words.中文: 他陷入沉思，對周圍的環境浑然不覺。

New Words.句子: The children were engrossed in the movie and didn’t notice the time passing
New Words.中文: 孩子們專心於電影，沒有注意到時間的流逝。

New Words.句子: He became engrossed in his work and forgot to eat lunch
New Words.中文: 他全心投入工作，忘了吃午餐。

New Words.句子: She read the novel with complete engrossment, unaware of the time passing
New Words.中文: 她全神貫注地讀著小說，完全沒有察覺時間的流逝。

New Words.句子: His engrossment in the project made him lose track of his surroundings
New Words.中文: 他全心投入項目，導致他失去了對周圍環境的感知。

New Words.句子: The engrossment of the contract was completed and ready for signing
New Words.中文: 合同的審核已經完成，並準備好簽署。

New Words.句子: The lawyer handled the engrossment of the agreement to ensure its accuracy
New Words.中文: 律師負責處理協議的定稿，以確保其準確性。

New Words.句子: The scholarship entitles students to free tuition for the entire year
New Words.中文: 這項獎學金讓學生有權享受全年免費學費。

New Words.句子: Employees are entitled to a paid vacation after one year of service
New Words.中文: 員工在服務一年後有權享受帶薪假期。

New Words.句子: Owning a ticket entitles you to enter the event
New Words.中文: 擁有門票讓你有權進入活動現場。

New Words.句子: She wrote a book entitled The Art of Simplicity
New Words.中文: 她寫了一本名為《簡單的藝術》的書。

New Words.句子: The painting was entitled Sunset Over the Lake
New Words.中文: 這幅畫被命名為《湖上日落》。

New Words.句子: The article is entitled The Future of Renewable Energy
New Words.中文: 這篇文章的標題是《可再生能源的未來》。

New Words.句子: Employees have an entitlement to paid holidays as per the company policy
New Words.中文: 根據公司政策，員工有權享受帶薪假期。

New Words.句子: The scholarship provides students with an entitlement to financial support for their education
New Words.中文: 獎學金為學生提供了教育資助的權利。

New Words.句子: His sense of entitlement made it difficult for him to accept constructive criticism
New Words.中文: 他過於自以為是的心態使得他難以接受建設性的批評。

New Words.句子: The manager's entitlement to respect was not reciprocated by the team due to her unfair treatment of staff
New Words.中文: 由於經理對員工的不公平對待，團隊並未回報她應得的尊重。

New Words.句子: They did not see government and society as two separate entities
New Words.中文: 他們不認為政府和社會是兩個獨立的實體。

New Words.句子: The virus is considered an independent biological entity capable of reproducing inside a host cell
The artist's vision of the sculpture was brought to life as a tangible entity in the gallery
The family business was incorporated as a legal entity to protect personal assets
Love is an abstract entity that cannot be measured but deeply influences human behavior
New Words.中文: 愛是一個抽象的實體，無法被測量，但深深影響著人類行為。

New Words.句子: The company is treated as a separate legal entity from its owners
New Words.中文: 該公司被視為與其所有者分開的獨立法實體。

New Words.句子: In philosophy, the concept of "mind" is often treated as a distinct entity from the physical body
New Words.中文: 在哲學中，“心靈”的概念常被視為與物質身體不同的實體。

New Words.句子: The university is an academic entity with its own policies and governance
The non-profit organization operates as a charitable entity, providing services to those in need
The idea of artificial intelligence has become an entity in itself, influencing various fields of research
Each department in the company is a separate entity, with its own budget and goals
The contract was signed by two entities: the service provider and the client
The city enveloped in snow looked so mysterious
New Words.中文: 被雪包圍的城市看起來如此神秘。

New Words.句子: The thick fog enveloped the entire city, reducing visibility to almost zero
New Words.中文: 濃霧籠罩了整個城市，能見度幾乎降到零。

New Words.句子: The dancer's flowing costume enveloped her body, adding to the elegance of her performance
New Words.中文: 舞者飄逸的服裝包裹著她的身體，為她的表演增添了優雅。

New Words.句子: The darkness of the cave enveloped them as they ventured deeper inside
New Words.中文: 當他們深入洞穴時，黑暗將他們包圍。

New Words.句子: The peaceful silence of the forest enveloped them, calming their restless minds
New Words.中文: 森林的寧靜包圍了他們，安撫了他們躁動的心靈。

New Words.句子: She sealed the letter in an envelope and addressed it to her friend
New Words.中文: 她將信封好，寫上朋友的地址。

New Words.句子: The envelope was beautifully decorated with a floral design
He opened the envelope with anticipation, eager to read the news inside
She received a red envelope for Chinese New Year, symbolizing good luck and prosperity
The thick fog formed an envelope around the city, making it hard to see
The protective envelope of the spacecraft shielded it from the harsh elements of space
The thick fog's envelopment of the landscape created an eerie atmosphere
New Words.中文: 濃霧將景觀籠罩，營造出一種詭異的氛圍。

New Words.句子: The envelopment of the package in bubble wrap protected it during shipping
New Words.中文: 包裹被氣泡膜包裹，這樣在運送過程中得到了保護。

New Words.句子: The soldiers found themselves in a dangerous envelopment by enemy forces
New Words.中文: 士兵們發現自己被敵軍包圍，處於危險之中。

New Words.句子: Both teams had equal chances of winning the match
New Words.中文: 兩支隊伍贏得比賽的機會均等。

New Words.句子: The two pieces of fabric are equal in length
New Words.中文: 這兩塊布料的長度相等。

New Words.句子: Everyone should have equal access to education
New Words.中文: 每個人都應該有平等接受教育的機會。

New Words.句子: The law requires equal treatment for all citizens
New Words.中文: 法律要求對所有公民平等對待。

New Words.句子: He hoped to equal the record set by the champion
New Words.中文: 他希望能追平冠軍創下的紀錄。

New Words.句子: The new law aims to equalize opportunities for all citizens
New Words.中文: 新法律旨在為所有公民平等化機會。

New Words.句子: In this competition, every participant is seen as an equal
New Words.中文: 在這場比賽中，每個參賽者都被視為平等。

New Words.句子: She treated her coworkers as equals, valuing their contributions
New Words.中文: 她平等對待她的同事，重視他們的貢獻。

New Words.句子: We need to equalize educational opportunities for all children
New Words.中文: 我們需要為所有孩子平等化教育機會。

New Words.句子: They took steps to equalize the opportunities for both genders at work
New Words.中文: 他們採取措施，在工作中為兩性平等化機會。

New Words.句子: The audio technician had to equalize the sound levels for the concert
New Words.中文: 這位音響技術員必須調整音量水平以配合音樂會。

New Words.句子: The referee's job is to equalize the game by ensuring fair play
New Words.中文: 裁判的工作是透過確保公平競賽來使比賽保持平衡。

New Words.句子: The company promotes equity by offering equal pay for equal work
New Words.中文: 該公司透過提供同工同酬來促進公平。

New Words.句子: The new law aims to bring greater equity in education
New Words.中文: 新法律旨在帶來教育領域的更大公平。

New Words.句子: She built equity in her home by making regular mortgage payments
New Words.中文: 她通過定期支付按揭款項，積累了房屋的資本價值。

New Words.句子: Investors are interested in the company's equity growth
New Words.中文: 投資者對該公司股本的增長感興趣。

New Words.句子: The equivalence between the two currencies allows for easy exchange at the same rate
New Words.中文: 兩種貨幣之間的等價性使得可以以相同的匯率進行簡便的交換。

New Words.句子: The job titles may sound different, but they have functional equivalence in responsibilities
New Words.中文: 職位名稱可能聽起來不同，但在職責上具有功能上的等價性。

New Words.句子: In physics, the theory of relativity demonstrates the equivalence between mass and energy
New Words.中文: 在物理學中，相對論理論展示了質量和能量之間的等價性。

New Words.句子: The two proposals are equivalent in cost, but one offers more benefits
New Words.中文: 這兩個提案在成本上是等同的，但其中一個提供更多的福利。

New Words.句子: His experience in the field is equivalent to a formal degree
New Words.中文: 他在該領域的經驗相當於一個正式的學位。

New Words.句子: One dollar is roughly the equivalent of 0
New Words.中文: 一美元大約相當於 0 (請補充具體貨幣或數字，以完成句子)。

New Words.句子: In terms of responsibility, her role is the equivalent of a department head
New Words.中文: 就責任而言，她的角色相當於一個部門主管。

New Words.句子: The Industrial Era transformed economies and societies with advancements in manufacturing and technology
New Words.中文: 工業時代透過製造業和科技的進步，徹底改變了經濟和社會。

New Words.句子: The Renaissance was an era of great artistic and intellectual achievement in Europe
New Words.中文: 文藝復興時代是歐洲藝術與智識成就輝煌的時期。

New Words.句子: Her college years were an era of exploration and self-discovery
New Words.中文: 她的大學時光是一段探索與自我發現的時期。

New Words.句子: His death marks the end of an era, as he was a beloved leader who united the community and inspired many
New Words.中文: 他的逝世標誌著一個時代的結束，因為他是一位深受愛戴的領袖，團結了社群並激勵了許多人。

New Words.句子: The office chair has an ergonomic design to support the lower back and encourage good posture
New Words.中文: (這把辦公椅具有符合人體工學的設計，有助於支撐下背部並促進良好的姿勢。)

New Words.句子: The company invested in ergonomic workstations to improve employee comfort and productivity
New Words.中文: (該公司投資了符合人體工學的工作站，以提高員工的舒適度和工作效率。)

New Words.句子: The stroller features an ergonomic handlebar to reduce strain on the parent's arms and wrists during long walks
New Words.中文: (這款推車具有符合人體工學的把手，可以減少家長在長時間散步時對手臂和手腕的壓力。)

New Words.句子: The chair is ergonomically designed to support the back and encourage proper posture
New Words.中文: (這款椅子採用了符合人體工學的設計，旨在支持背部並促進良好的姿勢。)

New Words.句子: The office was ergonomically arranged to maximize comfort and productivity for the employees
New Words.中文: (這個辦公室的佈局符合人體工學，旨在最大化員工的舒適度和生產力。)

New Words.句子: The stroller handle is ergonomically placed to reduce strain on the parent's arms during long walks
New Words.中文: (這款嬰兒推車的手柄符合人體工學設計，旨在減少長時間散步時對父母手臂的壓力。)

New Words.句子: The kitchen tools are ergonomically designed for ease of use, making meal prep less tiring
New Words.中文: (這些廚房工具符合人體工學設計，使用簡便，使準備餐點不那麼疲勞。)

New Words.句子: The company hired an expert in ergonomics to redesign the office layout and improve employee comfort
New Words.中文: (公司聘請了一位人體工學專家來重新設計辦公室佈局，提升員工的舒適度。)

New Words.句子: Good ergonomics in a workstation setup can reduce the risk of repetitive strain injuries
New Words.中文: (良好的工作站設置人體工學可以減少重複性應變傷害的風險。)

New Words.句子: The stroller's ergonomics are designed to make pushing easier on the user, with adjustable handles and a balanced frame
New Words.中文: (這款嬰兒車的人體工學設計旨在讓使用者推行更輕鬆，配有可調節的手把和平衡的車架。)

New Words.句子: The volcano erupted with a deafening roar, sending plumes of ash high into the sky
New Words.中文: 火山伴隨著震耳欲聾的轟鳴聲爆發，將大量火山灰噴射到高空中。

New Words.句子: Lava erupted from the crater, flowing down the mountainside
The argument between the two colleagues erupted into a shouting match in the middle of the office
Her frustration erupted when she found out about the last-minute changes to the project
The volcanic eruption caused widespread destruction and displaced thousands of people
New Words.中文: 火山爆發造成了大規模的破壞，並使數千人流離失所。

New Words.句子: Her eruption of laughter filled the room with warmth and happiness
New Words.中文: 她爆發出的笑聲為整個房間帶來了溫暖與歡樂。

New Words.句子: The eruption of applause greeted the performer as they took the stage
New Words.中文: 當表演者登上舞台時，爆發出的掌聲熱烈歡迎了他們。

New Words.句子: Their spontaneous escapade to the mountains ended with an unexpected encounter with a bear
New Words.中文: 他們臨時起意前往山中的冒險，最後竟意外地遇到了一隻熊。

New Words.句子: As a teenager he embarked on a series of ill-advised escapades
New Words.中文: 他在青少年時期展開了一連串不明智的冒險行為。

New Words.句子: The group’s escapade through the abandoned house became the talk of the neighborhood
New Words.中文: 這群人闖入廢棄房屋的冒險行為成了街坊鄰里的話題。

New Words.句子: Their overseas escapade during the summer break was filled with thrilling adventures and unforgettable memories
New Words.中文: 他們暑假期間的海外冒險充滿了刺激的歷險與難忘的回憶。

New Words.句子: The book's illustrations capture the essence of the story
New Words.中文: 這本書的插圖捕捉到了故事的精髓。

New Words.句子: The essence of her argument is that everyone deserves equal rights
New Words.中文: 她論點的核心是每個人都應該擁有平等的權利。

New Words.句子: The essence of his leadership style is empathy and integrity
New Words.中文: 他領導風格的核心是同理心與誠信。

New Words.句子: Vanilla essence is commonly used in baking to add flavor
New Words.中文: 香草精常用於烘焙中，以增添風味。

New Words.句子: The perfume is made from the essence of various flowers
New Words.中文: 這款香水是由多種花卉的精華製成的。

New Words.句子: Water is essential for all forms of life
New Words.中文: 水對所有形式的生命來說都是必不可少的。

New Words.句子: It’s essential to have a valid passport when traveling internationally
New Words.中文: 國際旅行時擁有有效護照是必不可少的。

New Words.句子: Good communication skills are essential for effective teamwork
New Words.中文: 良好的溝通技巧對於有效的團隊合作至關重要。

New Words.句子: Proper rest is essential for maintaining good health
New Words.中文: 適當的休息對於保持良好的健康至關重要。

New Words.句子: Food, water, and shelter are basic essentials for survival
New Words.中文: 食物、水和住所是生存的基本必需品。

New Words.句子: She packed only the essentials for her hiking trip
New Words.中文: 她為徒步旅行只打包了必需品。

New Words.句子: Understanding grammar is an essential for learning a new language
New Words.中文: 理解語法是學習新語言的基本要素。

New Words.句子: The kit includes all the camping essentials
New Words.中文: 這個套件包括所有露營必需品。

New Words.句子: His constant criticism estranged him from his family, making it difficult for them to stay close
New Words.中文: 他的持續批評使他與家人疏遠，讓他們很難保持親近關係。

New Words.句子: The argument estranged him from his wife
New Words.中文: 這場爭論使他與妻子疏遠。

New Words.句子: His foolish behavior estranged all his friends
New Words.中文: 他愚蠢的行為使他與所有朋友疏遠。

New Words.句子: The ethereal glow of the moonlit sky made the scene feel magical
New Words.中文: 月光下的虛幻光輝使得這個場景彷彿充滿了魔力。

New Words.句子: Her voice had an ethereal quality, almost as if it were not of this world
New Words.中文: 她的聲音帶有一種超凡脫俗的質感，彷彿不屬於這個世界。

New Words.句子: The ethereal nature of the dream left her with a sense of wonder and longing
New Words.中文: 夢境的超凡脫俗性質讓她充滿了驚奇與渴望。

New Words.句子: The concept of time is often seen as ethereal, impossible to fully understand or define
New Words.中文: 時間的概念常被視為虛無縹緲，難以完全理解或定義。

New Words.句子: The company's ethics include honesty and fairness in all business dealings
New Words.中文: 公司的倫理包括在所有商業交易中保持誠實和公平。

New Words.句子: She was admired for her strong work ethic and commitment to her job
New Words.中文: 她因為堅強的工作倫理和對工作的承諾而受到讚賞。

New Words.句子: Many debates center around the ethics of artificial intelligence and data privacy
New Words.中文: 許多辯論圍繞著人工智慧和數據隱私的倫理問題。

New Words.句子: The course in ethics covered theories from various philosophers on moral behavior
New Words.中文: 這門倫理學課程涵蓋了來自不同哲學家的道德行為理論。

New Words.句子: Philosophers have long debated the ethics of euthanasia and animal rights
New Words.中文: 哲學家們長期以來一直討論安樂死和動物權利的倫理問題。

New Words.句子: The European Union has implemented strict environmental regulations across its member states
New Words.中文: 歐洲聯盟在其成員國實施了嚴格的環境法規。

New Words.句子: The UK's departure from the EU, known as Brexit, marked a significant shift in European politics
New Words.中文: 英國脫歐（Brexit）標誌著歐洲政治的重大變革。

New Words.句子: The European Union is working to strengthen its relations with other countries around the world
New Words.中文: 歐洲聯盟正在努力加強與世界其他國家的關係。

New Words.句子: The debate over euthanasia raises complex ethical and legal issues
New Words.中文: 安樂死的辯論引發了複雜的倫理和法律問題。

New Words.句子: Some countries have legalized euthanasia under strict regulations to ensure it is carried out ethically
New Words.中文: 一些國家已經在嚴格的規定下合法化了安樂死，以確保其在倫理上得以正當執行。

New Words.句子: The patient chose euthanasia to avoid prolonged suffering from a terminal illness
New Words.中文: 患者選擇了安樂死，以避免因末期病痛而長時間的痛苦。

New Words.句子: The veterinarian performed euthanasia on the dog to end its suffering from a severe injury
New Words.中文: 獸醫為了結束狗狗因重傷而帶來的痛苦，進行了安樂死。

New Words.句子: The civilians were evacuated from the city to farms
New Words.中文: 平民從城市撤離，轉移到農場。

New Words.句子: During the fire drill, students practiced the procedures for safely evacuating the school building in case of an emergency
New Words.中文: 在消防演習中，學生們練習了在緊急情況下安全撤離學校建築的程序。

New Words.句子: The authorities ordered residents to evacuate the coastal area ahead of the approaching hurricane
New Words.中文: 當局命令居民在颶風逼近之前撤離沿海地區。

New Words.句子: The teacher will evaluate the students' projects based on creativity and originality
New Words.中文: 老師將根據創意和原創性來評估學生的項目。

New Words.句子: We need to evaluate the effectiveness of the new marketing strategy
New Words.中文: 我們需要評估新行銷策略的效果。

New Words.句子: The committee will evaluate the proposals before making a decision
New Words.中文: 該委員會將在做出決定之前評估這些提案。

New Words.句子: The politician gave evasive answers to avoid addressing the controversial issue
New Words.中文: (那位政治家給出了回避性的答案，以避免正面回答爭議性問題。)

New Words.句子: She became evasive when asked about her future plans
New Words.中文: (當被問及她的未來計劃時，她變得回避。)

New Words.句子: His evasive behavior made others suspicious of his intentions
New Words.中文: (他的回避行為讓其他人對他的意圖感到懷疑。)

New Words.句子: The driver took evasive action to avoid hitting the deer
New Words.中文: (司機採取了回避行動，以避免撞上那隻鹿。)

New Words.句子: Their vacation was eventful, filled with adventures like hiking, snorkeling, and exploring new cities
New Words.中文: 他們的假期充滿了各種事件，像是徒步旅行、浮潛和探索新城市等冒險活動。

New Words.句子: The conference was quite eventful, with several key speakers and unexpected announcements
New Words.中文: 這次會議相當充實，有幾位重要的演講者和一些出乎意料的宣布。

New Words.句子: She had an eventful week, attending three parties and a concert
New Words.中文: 她度過了一個充實的星期，參加了三場派對和一場音樂會。

New Words.句子: The year was eventful for the company, marked by major expansions and product launches
New Words.中文: 對於公司來說，這一年充滿了變故，標誌著重大擴張和產品發布。

New Words.句子: His life has been eventful, with many challenges and accomplishments along the way
New Words.中文: 他的生活充滿了變故，沿途經歷了許多挑戰和成就。

New Words.句子: The old photograph evoked memories of summers spent at the lake with her family, bringing a wave of nostalgia washing over her
New Words.中文: 那張舊照片喚起了她與家人一起度過的湖邊夏日回憶，讓一股懷舊的情感湧上心頭。

New Words.句子: That old movie evoked memories of my childhood
New Words.中文: 那部舊電影喚起了我童年的回憶。

New Words.句子: Music has the power to evoke emotions that words cannot reach.
New Words.中文: 音樂擁有喚起言語難以觸及的情感的力量。

New Words.句子: My art is meant to evoke the pain and passion that shaped my soul.
New Words.中文: 我的藝術旨在喚起那些塑造我靈魂的痛苦與熱情。

New Words.句子: Birds are believed to have evolved from dinosaurs over millions of years
New Words.中文: 鳥類被認為是從恐龍進化而來的，經過了數百萬年的演變。

New Words.句子: The design of smartphones has evolved significantly over the years, becoming sleeker, more functional, and aesthetically pleasing as technology advances
New Words.中文: 智能手機的設計隨著時間的推移顯著演變，隨著科技的進步，變得更加精緻、功能更強大，並且在美學上更具吸引力。

New Words.句子: The design of strollers has evolved significantly over the years, becoming more ergonomic, versatile, and stylish to meet the needs of modern parents
New Words.中文: 嬰兒車的設計隨著時間的推移顯著演變，變得更加符合人體工學、多功能，並且更加時尚，以滿足現代父母的需求。

New Words.句子: The sales exceeded my expectation
New Words.中文: 銷售額超出了我的預期。

New Words.句子: His older brother exceeds him in intelligence
New Words.中文: 他的哥哥在智慧上超過了他。

New Words.句子: The number of participants exceeded our expectations
New Words.中文: 參與者的數量超出了我們的預期。

New Words.句子: He was taken to the police box for exceeding the speed limit
New Words.中文: 他因為超速被帶到警察局。

New Words.句子: He exceeded the speed limit and got a ticket
New Words.中文: 他超速了，並因此收到了一張罰單。

New Words.句子: Her dedication to her work resulted in excellence in every project she completed
New Words.中文: 她對工作的奉獻使她在每個完成的項目中都達到了卓越的成果。

New Words.句子: The school is known for its academic excellence and strong curriculum
New Words.中文: 這所學校以其學術卓越和強大的課程而聞名。

New Words.句子: The company strives for excellence in customer service by continually improving their support team
New Words.中文: 該公司通過不斷提升支持團隊，致力於在客戶服務方面達到卓越。

New Words.句子: His excellence in sports earned him numerous awards and recognitions
New Words.中文: 他在運動方面的卓越表現為他贏得了無數獎項和認可。

New Words.句子: She read an excerpt from her favorite book during the event
New Words.中文: 她在活動中讀了她最喜歡書籍的節選。

New Words.句子: The article includes excerpts from the interview with the author
New Words.中文: 這篇文章包含了對作者訪談的節選。

New Words.句子: The teacher excerpted parts of the novel for classroom discussion
New Words.中文: 老師摘錄了小說的部分內容進行課堂討論。

New Words.句子: They excerpted several lines from his speech for the news report
New Words.中文: 他們從他的演講中摘錄了幾句話用於新聞報導。

New Words.句子: The government says that local authority spending is excessive
New Words.中文: 政府表示地方當局的開支過度。

New Words.句子: The food was bad and the bill was excessive
New Words.中文: 食物很差，而帳單也過高。

New Words.句子: She was criticized for her excessive use of social media during work hours
New Words.中文: 她因為在工作時間過度使用社交媒體而受到批評。

New Words.句子: Excessive noise from the construction site disturbed the entire neighborhood
New Words.中文: 建築工地的過度噪音打擾了整個社區。

New Words.句子: The club decided to exclude new members until the end of the year
New Words.中文: 俱樂部決定在年底之前排除新會員。

New Words.句子: She felt excluded from the conversation because she wasn’t familiar with the topic
New Words.中文: 她因為不熟悉話題而感到被排除在對話之外。

New Words.句子: You can share files with some people on the network while excluding others
New Words.中文: 你可以在網絡上與某些人分享文件，同時排除其他人。

New Words.句子: The policy aims to exclude any unfair practices from the hiring process
New Words.中文: 該政策旨在排除招聘過程中的任何不公平做法。

New Words.句子: Certain expenses are excluded from the budget calculations
New Words.中文: 某些開支被排除在預算計算之外。

New Words.句子: The prices on the menu exclude tax
New Words.中文: 菜單上的價格不包括稅。

New Words.句子: The kidneys play a vital role in the excretion of waste from the bloodstream
New Words.中文: 腎臟在從血液中排出廢物的過程中扮演著至關重要的角色。

New Words.句子: Excess salt and water are removed from the body through excretion
New Words.中文: 多餘的鹽分和水分是透過排泄從體內排出的。

New Words.句子: Proper excretion is essential for maintaining the body's internal balance
New Words.中文: 正常的排泄對於維持身體的內部平衡是至關重要的。

New Words.句子: The thought of losing her family would excruciate her deeply
New Words.中文: 一想到失去家人，她就會感到極度痛苦。

New Words.句子: The intense headache seemed to excruciate him for hours
New Words.中文: 劇烈的頭痛似乎折磨了他好幾個小時。

New Words.句子: The long wait for the test results excruciated him with anxiety
New Words.中文: 漫長等待檢驗結果的過程使他焦慮萬分。

New Words.句子: Witnessing injustice can excruciate those who value fairness
New Words.中文: 目睹不公會讓重視公平正義的人感到極度痛苦。

New Words.句子: Enduring the boring small talk at the party was excruciating for someone who disliked superficial conversations
New Words.中文: 對於不喜歡膚淺對話的人來說，忍受派對上無聊的寒暄是一種極大的折磨。

New Words.句子: Running a marathon requires intense exertion
New Words.中文: 跑馬拉松需要極大的體力消耗。

New Words.句子: He was exhausted from the exertion of lifting heavy boxes
New Words.中文: 他因為舉起重箱而筋疲力盡。

New Words.句子: The exertion of authority was necessary to restore order
New Words.中文: 行使權威是為了恢復秩序所必須的。

New Words.句子: His success was the result of the constant exertion of effort and determination
New Words.中文: 他的成功是持續努力和決心的結果。

New Words.句子: The existence of extraterrestrial life remains a topic of great debate among scientists
New Words.中文: 外星生命的存在仍然是科學家們爭論的熱門話題。

New Words.句子: Many philosophical discussions revolve around the existence of free will
New Words.中文: 許多哲學討論圍繞著自由意志的存在。

New Words.句子: The existence of the ancient ruins was confirmed by the archaeological team
New Words.中文: 考古團隊確認了古代遺跡的存在。

New Words.句子: We do not believe in the existence of ghosts
New Words.中文: 我們不相信鬼魂的存在。

New Words.句子: We shouldn't deny the existence of these problems
New Words.中文: 我們不應該否認這些問題的存在。

New Words.句子: The expansive desert stretched endlessly under the hot sun
New Words.中文: (廣闊的沙漠在炎熱的陽光下無邊無際地延展。)

New Words.句子: The house had an expansive view of the ocean from every window
New Words.中文: (這座房子從每個窗戶都有一個開闊的海景。)

New Words.句子: She had an expansive knowledge of history, spanning many cultures and eras
New Words.中文: (她擁有廣泛的歷史知識，涵蓋了許多文化和時代。)

New Words.句子: His expansive personality made him the center of attention at every gathering
New Words.中文: (她擁有廣泛的歷史知識，涵蓋了許多文化和時代。)

New Words.句子: To meet the tight deadline, the manager decided to expedite the production process by allocating additional resources and working overtime
New Words.中文: 為了趕上緊迫的截止日期，經理決定通過分配額外資源和加班來加快生產過程。

New Words.句子: In order to avoid any delays, please expedite the approval process for the new project proposal
New Words.中文: 為了避免任何延誤，請加快新項目提案的批准流程。

New Words.句子: The company hired extra staff to expedite the delivery of holiday orders
New Words.中文: 公司雇用了額外的員工來加快假日訂單的配送速度。

New Words.句子: We need to expedite the visa application process to ensure timely travel
New Words.中文: 我們需要加快簽證申請流程，以確保及時出行。

New Words.句子: The team set out on an expedition to explore the uncharted regions of the Amazon rainforest
New Words.中文: 這支隊伍啟程進行一次探險，探索亞馬遜雨林中未被繪製的區域。

New Words.句子: The expedition reached the summit after weeks of climbing through harsh conditions
New Words.中文: 探險隊經過數週在惡劣條件下攀爬，終於抵達山頂。

New Words.句子: They went on a shopping expedition to find the perfect outfit for the party
New Words.中文: 他們進行了一次購物探險，尋找適合派對的完美服裝。

New Words.句子: Our weekend expedition to the flea market yielded some great vintage finds
New Words.中文: 我們週末前往跳蚤市場的探險，發現了一些很棒的復古收藏品。

New Words.句子: The student was expelled from school for violating the rules
New Words.中文: 那名學生因為違反規則而被開除學校。

New Words.句子: The country decided to expel the foreign diplomat for espionage
New Words.中文: 該國決定因從事間諜活動而驅逐那位外國外交官。

New Words.句子: The lungs expel carbon dioxide when we exhale
New Words.中文: 我們呼氣時，肺部會排出二氧化碳。

New Words.句子: The volcano expelled a massive cloud of ash and smoke
New Words.中文: 火山噴出大量的火山灰和煙霧。

New Words.句子: The instructions were explicit, so everyone knew what to do
New Words.中文: 指示非常明確，所以每個人都知道該做什麼。

New Words.句子: She gave explicit directions to the venue to avoid misunderstandings
New Words.中文: 她給了明確的會場指示，以避免誤會。

New Words.句子: The contract contains explicit terms regarding payment and deadlines
New Words.中文: 合約中包含了關於付款和截止日期的明確條款。

New Words.句子: The movie was rated R due to its explicit language and violent scenes
New Words.中文: 這部電影因其露骨的語言和暴力場面而被評為限制級（R級）。

New Words.句子: His explicit remarks shocked everyone at the meeting
New Words.中文: 他直白的言論讓會議上的每個人都感到震驚。

New Words.句子: The book includes explicit descriptions of historical events
New Words.中文: 這本書包含對歷史事件的詳細描述。

New Words.句子: Sora is a creative tool, so please avoid harmful use, including creating explicit, violent, harassing, or deceptive content
New Words.中文: Sora 是一個創意工具，請避免不當使用，包括製作露骨、暴力、騷擾或具誤導性的內容。

New Words.句子: The teacher explicitly explained the instructions for the project
New Words.中文: 老師明確地解釋了專案的指示。

New Words.句子: The contract explicitly states the terms of payment
New Words.中文: 合約明確列出了付款條款。

New Words.句子: She explicitly asked for a detailed report on the matter
New Words.中文: 她明確要求提供有關此事的詳細報告。

New Words.句子: The guidelines explicitly outline the steps to follow
New Words.中文: 這些指導方針明確列出了需遵循的步驟。

New Words.句子: He was explicitly told not to enter the restricted area
New Words.中文: 他被明確告知不得進入限制區域。

New Words.句子: The manual explicitly describes how to operate the machinery
New Words.中文: 手冊明確描述了如何操作這些機械設備。

New Words.句子: The artist created an exquisite painting that captivated everyone who saw it
New Words.中文: 那位藝術家創作了一幅精緻的畫作，吸引了每一位觀看過的人。

New Words.句子: She wore an exquisite necklace made of rare gemstones
New Words.中文: 她戴著一條由稀有寶石製成的精緻項鍊。

New Words.句子: The restaurant is known for its exquisite cuisine that features unique flavors
New Words.中文: 這家餐廳以其獨特風味的精緻料理聞名。

New Words.句子: He felt an exquisite joy when he heard the good news
New Words.中文: 當他聽到好消息時，他感到了一種極致的喜悅。

New Words.句子: The pain was exquisite, leaving her breathless
New Words.中文: 那痛苦是如此劇烈，讓她無法呼吸。

New Words.句子: They experienced an exquisite moment of silence during the ceremony
New Words.中文: 在典禮期間，他們經歷了一個精緻的寧靜時刻。

New Words.句子: The extent of the damage from the storm was more severe than initially thought
New Words.中文: 風暴造成的損害程度比最初想像的更為嚴重。

New Words.句子: She did not realize the extent of his knowledge on the subject
New Words.中文: 她沒有意識到他在這個主題上的知識深度。

New Words.句子: The project was completed to a large extent, but some details still needed to be finalized
New Words.中文: 這個項目已經在很大程度上完成，但仍有一些細節需要最終確定。

New Words.句子: The extent of his influence in the company is well-known
New Words.中文: 他在公司中的影響力是廣為人知的。

New Words.句子: The dentist extracted the wisdom tooth carefully
The article included extracts from her interviews
He managed to extract the key from the locked door
Scientists extracted DNA from the samples
The company extracts oil from deep underground
She extracted valuable insights from the research data
He extracted a quote from the speech for his article
Vanilla extract is commonly used in baking
The herbal extract is known for its medicinal properties
He read an extract from his favorite novel
The extraction of oil from the ground can have environmental impacts
The dentist performed a tooth extraction to alleviate pain
The extraction of DNA from biological samples is crucial for genetic testing
Information extraction from the data set helped the researchers draw valuable conclusions
The extraction of important insights from the report was essential for decision-making
The extractive industry includes mining, oil drilling, and gas extraction
Extractive methods are often used to obtain minerals from deep within the earth
Certain chemicals have extractive properties that remove impurities from liquids
Plant extractives are commonly used in herbal medicine and cosmetics
The report studied the economic impact of extractives like crude oil and metals
The scientists are researching extraterrestrial life forms that might exist on other planets
The film depicted an extraterrestrial invasion of Earth
The discovery of a mysterious object in space was thought to be of extraterrestrial origin
Some people believe that extraterrestrials have visited Earth in the past
He was exuding with confidence when he took the podium
Even in challenging situations, Sarah always seemed to exude calmness and composure, which had a calming effect on those around her
He was exuding confidence when he took the podium
The tree exuded a sticky sap from its bark after being damaged
His speech exuded warmth and sincerity, making everyone feel welcomed
The new software will facilitate communication between team members
The teacher's role is to facilitate discussions among students
The new product design was developed to facilitate easier use by consumers
Cutting taxes may facilitate economic recovery
The partnership was formed to facilitate the exchange of ideas between the two organizations
The mediator's goal is to facilitate a resolution to the dispute
The temperature outside was 85 degrees Fahrenheit
New Words.中文: 外面的溫度是85華氏度。

New Words.句子: The weather report showed it would be 30°F tonight
New Words.中文: 天氣報告顯示今晚會有30華氏度。

New Words.句子: The room was heated to a comfortable Fahrenheit level
New Words.中文: 房間被加熱到一個舒適的華氏溫度。

New Words.句子: You can convert Celsius temperatures to Fahrenheit using a simple formula
New Words.中文: 你可以使用簡單的公式將攝氏溫度轉換為華氏溫度：華氏溫度 (°F) = 攝氏溫度 (°C) × 9/5 + 32

New Words.句子: The accountant was caught falsifying the company's financial records to hide losses
He tried to falsify the data to make the experiment seem more successful
The witness was accused of falsifying his testimony under oath
Officials were arrested for falsifying documents to approve illegal activities
The plant’s fan-shaped leaves spread out gracefully in the garden
New Words.中文: 這株植物的扇形葉子在花園中優雅地展開。

New Words.句子: The fan-shaped seating arrangement allowed everyone to have a clear view of the stage
New Words.中文: 扇形的座位安排讓每個人都能清楚地看到舞台。

New Words.句子: The building features a fan-shaped roof that gives it a unique architectural style
New Words.中文: 這棟建築擁有扇形的屋頂，賦予它獨特的建築風格。

New Words.句子: The magician's tricks fascinated the audience
She is fascinated by ancient history and loves reading about it
The intricate details of the painting were fascinating to everyone at the gallery
His stories about his travels to remote places never fail to fascinate his listeners
The documentary about deep-sea creatures was absolutely fascinating
She fastened her seatbelt before the car started moving
New Words.中文: 她在汽車開始行駛前繫好了安全帶。

New Words.句子: He fastened the lid tightly on the jar
New Words.中文: 他把罐子的蓋子緊緊地蓋上了。

New Words.句子: Don't forget to fasten your shoes before you go outside
New Words.中文: 在你出門之前，別忘了把鞋帶繫好。

New Words.句子: The workers fastened the ropes to the ship to secure it to the dock
New Words.中文: 工人們將繩索繫在船上，以便將它固定在碼頭上。

New Words.句子: They fastened the door shut to prevent anyone from entering
New Words.中文: 他們將門牢牢關上，以防止任何人進入。

New Words.句子: The photo was fastened to the wall with a pin
New Words.中文: 照片用圖釘固定在牆上。

New Words.句子: She fastened the label to the box
New Words.中文: 她把標籤固定在箱子上。

New Words.句子: After a long day of work, he was overcome by fatigue and went straight to bed
New Words.中文: 經過一天的工作，他感到極度疲勞，直接上床睡覺。

New Words.句子: The marathon runner experienced fatigue near the end of the race
New Words.中文: 馬拉松選手在比賽接近尾聲時感到疲勞。

New Words.句子: Chronic fatigue can be a symptom of various health conditions
New Words.中文: 慢性疲勞可能是多種健康狀況的症狀之一。

New Words.句子: Engineers checked for metal fatigue in the bridge's supports to ensure its safety under heavy loads
New Words.中文: 工程師檢查橋樑支撐結構是否有金屬疲勞，以確保其在重載下的安全性。

New Words.句子: The stroller's frame showed signs of fatigue after undergoing several stress tests, raising concerns about its durability
New Words.中文: 嬰兒車的框架在經過多次壓力測試後出現疲勞跡象，引發了對其耐用性的擔憂。

New Words.句子: The long hours at the construction site fatigued the workers
New Words.中文: 長時間在建築工地工作使工人感到疲憊。

New Words.句子: The demanding schedule will fatigue even the most energetic employees
New Words.中文: 繁重的日程安排即使是最精力充沛的員工也會感到疲勞。

New Words.句子: The team conducted a feasibility study to determine if the project could be completed within budget
New Words.中文: 該團隊進行了一項可行性研究，以確定該專案是否能在預算內完成。

New Words.句子: The feasibility of building a bridge in that location was questioned due to environmental concerns
New Words.中文: 由於環境方面的考量，在該地點建造橋樑的可行性受到質疑。

New Words.句子: Before launching the product, they evaluated the feasibility of manufacturing it at scale
New Words.中文: 在推出產品之前，他們評估了大規模生產的可行性。

New Words.句子: The engineer explained the technical feasibility of implementing the proposed design
New Words.中文: 工程師解釋了實施所提出設計的技術可行性。

New Words.句子: The family prepared a grand feast for the holiday
New Words.中文: 這個家庭為假期準備了一頓豐盛的盛宴。

New Words.句子: They feasted on roasted turkey and pumpkin pie
New Words.中文: 他們大快朵頤，吃著烤火雞和南瓜派。

New Words.句子: After the long journey, they feasted on fresh seafood
New Words.中文: 經過長時間的旅行後，他們大快朵頤，享用了新鮮的海鮮。

New Words.句子: The guests feasted until they were completely full
New Words.中文: 賓客們大快朵頤，直到他們完全吃飽為止。

New Words.句子: She feasted her eyes on the breathtaking sunset
New Words.中文: 她目不轉睛地欣賞著令人屏息的日落。

New Words.句子: The audience feasted on the stunning performance
New Words.中文: 觀眾陶醉於那場精彩的表演。

New Words.句子: He feasted on the beautiful scenery of the countryside
New Words.中文: 他陶醉於鄉村的美麗景色。

New Words.句子: They enjoyed a delicious feast at the wedding banquet
New Words.中文: 他們在婚宴上享用了美味的盛宴。

New Words.句子: The royal feast included a variety of exotic dishes
New Words.中文: 皇室的盛宴包括了各式各樣的異國料理。

New Words.句子: Many cultures hold annual feasts to honor their traditions
New Words.中文: 許多文化每年舉行盛宴，以尊崇他們的傳統。

New Words.句子: The Feast of Thanksgiving is widely celebrated in the United States
New Words.中文: 感恩節盛宴在美國廣泛慶祝。

New Words.句子: The town hosted a feast to celebrate the harvest season
New Words.中文: 這個小鎮舉辦了盛宴來慶祝豐收季節。

New Words.句子: The concert was a feast for the ears
New Words.中文: 音樂會是一場聽覺的饗宴。

New Words.句子: The museum exhibit was a feast for the eyes
New Words.中文: 博物館的展覽是一場視覺的饗宴。

New Words.句子: The book offers a feast of knowledge about ancient civilizations
New Words.中文: 這本書提供了關於古代文明的豐富知識。

New Words.句子: The fellowship among team members helped them work more effectively together
New Words.中文: 隊員之間的情誼幫助他們更有效地合作。

New Words.句子: Their fellowship grew stronger through shared experiences during the challenging project
New Words.中文: 他們在這個充滿挑戰的專案中透過共同的經歷使彼此的情誼更加深厚。

New Words.句子: The fellowship of artists at the retreat encouraged creativity and collaboration
New Words.中文: 藝術家們在靜修營中的夥伴情誼激發了創意與合作。

New Words.句子: The book club formed a fellowship that deepened their appreciation for literature
New Words.中文: 讀書會建立起的情誼加深了他們對文學的欣賞。

New Words.句子: The writers' fellowship met every month to discuss their projects and provide feedback
New Words.中文: 作家協會每月聚會，討論他們的專案並提供反饋。

New Words.句子: The science fellowship included researchers from various fields who shared their findings
New Words.中文: 這個科學研究協會包括來自各個領域的研究人員，他們分享了自己的研究成果。

New Words.句子: She received a fellowship to support her studies and research in environmental science
New Words.中文: 她獲得了一個獎學金，用以支持她在環境科學領域的學習和研究。

New Words.句子: The university offers fellowships to help students focus on their research without financial worries
New Words.中文: 這所大學提供獎學金，幫助學生專注於研究，而無需擔心財務問題。

New Words.句子: The fermentation of grapes produces wine
New Words.中文: 葡萄的發酵產生了葡萄酒。

New Words.句子: The yeast causes the dough to undergo a slow ferment, making it rise
New Words.中文: 酵母使麵糰經過緩慢發酵，從而使其膨脹。

New Words.句子: The country was in a state of ferment after the announcement of the new law
New Words.中文: 在新法律宣布後，該國處於動盪不安的狀態。

New Words.句子: The bread dough must ferment for several hours before baking
New Words.中文: 麵包麵糰在烘焙之前必須發酵幾個小時。

New Words.句子: The wine was left to ferment in barrels for six months
New Words.中文: 葡萄酒被放在桶中發酵了六個月。

New Words.句子: His ideas began to ferment in the minds of the group, leading to a major change
New Words.中文: 他的想法在小組成員的心中發酵，最終引發了重大的變革。

New Words.句子: The fermentation of grapes produces wine and carbon dioxide
New Words.中文: 葡萄的發酵過程會產生酒精和二氧化碳。

New Words.句子: The bacteria are responsible for the fermentation process in yogurt
New Words.中文: 細菌負責酸奶中的發酵過程。

New Words.句子: The fermentation of dough helps it rise before baking
New Words.中文: 麵團的發酵過程有助於在烘焙前使其膨脹。

New Words.句子: Fermentation is a key step in the production of beer and spirits
New Words.中文: 發酵是啤酒和烈酒製作過程中的關鍵步驟。

New Words.句子: The farmer used organic fertilizer to improve the soil quality
New Words.中文: 農夫使用有機肥料來改善土壤質量。

New Words.句子: This type of fertilizer contains nitrogen, phosphorus, and potassium
New Words.中文: 這種類型的肥料含有氮、磷和鉀。

New Words.句子: Applying too much fertilizer can harm the environment
New Words.中文: 施用過多肥料可能會對環境造成危害。

New Words.句子: The feud between the two families lasted for generations
New Words.中文: 兩個家族之間的世仇延續了好幾代。

New Words.句子: The political feud between the two leaders intensified over time
New Words.中文: 兩位領袖之間的政治爭執隨著時間的推移而加劇。

New Words.句子: Their feud started over a small misunderstanding but grew into a major conflict
New Words.中文: 他們的爭執起初是由一個小小的誤會開始，但卻發展成為一場重大衝突。

New Words.句子: The two companies feuded over the rights to the product
New Words.中文: 這兩家公司因產品的權利而爭執不休。

New Words.句子: The brothers feuded for years over their inheritance
New Words.中文: 這兩兄弟因繼承權爭執了多年。

New Words.句子: The rival teams have been feuding for decades
New Words.中文: 這兩支對立的隊伍已經爭執了幾十年。

New Words.句子: After reviewing the data, she tried to figure out the best course of action
New Words.中文: 在審查數據後，她試圖找出最佳行動方案。

New Words.句子: I can't figure out why my computer isn't working
New Words.中文: 我無法弄清楚為什麼我的電腦無法運作。

New Words.句子: He figured that leaving early would help him avoid traffic
New Words.中文: 他認為提早離開可以幫助他避開交通擁堵。

New Words.句子: The budget includes several financial figures, such as revenue projections and expense estimates
New Words.中文: 預算包括多項財務數據，例如收入預測和支出估算。

New Words.句子: She earns a six-figure salary at her new job
New Words.中文: 她在新工作中賺取六位數的薪水。

New Words.句子: As a leading figure in the tech industry, she is often sought after for her insights and expertise
New Words.中文: 作為科技行業的領軍人物，她經常因為她的見解和專業知識而受到追捧。

New Words.句子: The historical figure played a crucial role in shaping modern policies
New Words.中文: 這位歷史人物在塑造現代政策方面發揮了至關重要的作用。

New Words.句子: From a distance, the figure of the mountain stood majestic against the sunset sky
New Words.中文: 從遠處看，山的輪廓在夕陽的映照下顯得雄偉壯麗。

New Words.句子: The shadowy figure disappeared into the night
New Words.中文: 那個陰影中的身影消失在夜色中。

New Words.句子: She has a collection of porcelain figurines displayed on the shelf
New Words.中文: 她在架子上擺放了一系列瓷器人物。

New Words.句子: The museum featured intricate wooden figurines from ancient civilizations
New Words.中文: 博物館展示了來自古代文明的精緻木製人物雕像。

New Words.句子: He gave her a small figurine of a dog as a gift
New Words.中文: 他送給她一個小狗的雕像作為禮物。

New Words.句子: She placed the important documents in a file labeled "Confidential"
New Words.中文: 她將重要文件放入標註為「機密」的文件夾中。

New Words.句子: The carpenter filed the wood to create a smooth surface
New Words.中文: 木匠將木材打磨，以創造光滑的表面。

New Words.句子: The office maintains an electronic file for every employee
New Words.中文: 辦公室為每位員工保持電子檔案。

New Words.句子: The lawyer reviewed the case file before the trial
New Words.中文: 律師在審判前檢視了案件檔案。

New Words.句子: He used a metal file to smooth the edges of the steel
New Words.中文: 他使用金屬銼刀平滑鋼材的邊緣。

New Words.句子: She carefully filed the wooden surface to remove any rough patches
New Words.中文: 她小心地銼平木材表面，去除任何粗糙的部分。

New Words.句子: She filed the paperwork in the correct folder
New Words.中文: 她將文件歸檔在正確的資料夾中。

New Words.句子: The secretary spent the afternoon filing the client forms
New Words.中文: 秘書花了一個下午整理客戶表格。

New Words.句子: The assistant filed the reports for easy retrieval
New Words.中文: 助理將報告歸檔，方便日後檢索。

New Words.句子: He filed the nails carefully to give them a clean, even shape
New Words.中文: 他小心地銼平指甲，讓它們呈現乾淨且均勻的形狀。

New Words.句子: She handled the negotiation with great finesse
New Words.中文: 她以極大的巧妙處理了這次談判。

New Words.句子: The artist painted with incredible finesse and precision
New Words.中文: 這位藝術家以難以置信的精緻和精確度作畫。

New Words.句子: His finesse in dealing with difficult clients made him successful
New Words.中文: 他處理難纏客戶的高超技巧使他取得了成功。

New Words.句子: The dancer performed with grace and finesse
New Words.中文: 舞者以優雅和精湛的技巧表演。

New Words.句子: The chef’s finesse in preparing gourmet dishes was remarkable
New Words.中文: 這位廚師在準備美食方面的精湛技藝令人驚豔。

New Words.句子: He finessed his way out of the difficult conversation
New Words.中文: 他巧妙地化解了那場困難的對話。

New Words.句子: She finessed the deal by carefully persuading both parties
New Words.中文: 她巧妙地完成了這筆交易，通過精心說服雙方達成協議。

New Words.句子: The team finessed a last-minute victory with a clever strategy
New Words.中文: 這支隊伍以巧妙的策略在最後一刻獲得了勝利。

New Words.句子: He finessed his escape from the tricky situation
New Words.中文: 他巧妙地脫身於這個棘手的情況。

New Words.句子: The government has introduced a new fiscal policy to control inflation
New Words.中文: 政府已推出新的財政政策，以控制通貨膨脹。

New Words.句子: Fiscal year 2023 saw significant changes in the budget
New Words.中文: 2023 財政年度預算經歷了重大變動。

New Words.句子: The company is adjusting its fiscal strategies to improve profits
New Words.中文: 公司正在調整其財政策略，以提高利潤。

New Words.句子: The fiscal health of the nation is crucial for long-term stability
New Words.中文: 國家的財政健康對於長期穩定至關重要。

New Words.句子: Fiscal responsibility is essential for a sustainable economy
New Words.中文: 財政責任對於維持可持續的經濟至關重要。

New Words.句子: She decorated her home with a flair for design, making it feel warm and inviting
New Words.中文: 她以卓越的設計眼光裝飾她的家，讓它看起來既溫暖又充滿邀請感。

New Words.句子: His writing has a certain flair that captivates readers and keeps them engaged
New Words.中文: 他的寫作風格獨具魅力，能吸引讀者並讓他們保持專注。

New Words.句子: They opened a restaurant with a European flair, featuring unique dishes and an elegant ambiance
New Words.中文: 他們開了一家帶有歐洲風情的餐廳，提供獨特的菜餚和優雅的氛圍。

New Words.句子: The product was designed with a modern flair, attracting customers with its sleek lines and vibrant colors
New Words.中文: 這款產品以現代風格設計，吸引顧客的目光，擁有流線型的外觀和鮮豔的色彩。

New Words.句子: He has a flair for cooking, often creating delicious dishes without following a recipe
New Words.中文: 他對烹飪有天賦，經常能不依照食譜創造出美味的菜肴。

New Words.句子: The artist showcased her flair in the use of color, creating vibrant and eye-catching paintings
New Words.中文: 這位藝術家在色彩運用上展示了她的天賦，創作出色彩鮮豔且引人注目的畫作。

New Words.句子: She has a little flair for conversation, effortlessly engaging everyone at the table
New Words.中文: 她擁有一點交談的魅力，能輕鬆地吸引桌上每個人的注意。

New Words.句子: Her performance was flawless, receiving standing ovations from the audience
New Words.中文: 她的表現無可挑剔，贏得了觀眾的起立鼓掌。

New Words.句子: The diamond was flawless, with no visible imperfections
New Words.中文: 這顆鑽石完美無瑕，沒有任何可見的瑕疵。

New Words.句子: He gave a flawless presentation during the meeting
New Words.中文: 他在會議中做了一場完美無瑕的演講。

New Words.句子: She found a vintage lamp at the flea market that perfectly matched her living room decor
New Words.中文: 她在跳蚤市場找到了一盞復古燈，完美地與她的客廳裝飾相配。

New Words.句子: The flea market was filled with stalls offering everything from old records to handmade crafts
New Words.中文: 跳蚤市場裡擺滿了攤位，提供從舊唱片到手工藝品的各種商品。

New Words.句子: The navy deployed its largest fleet to the region
New Words.中文: 海軍將其最大規模的艦隊部署到該地區。

New Words.句子: The clouds fleeted across the sky before the storm arrived
New Words.中文: 雲朵在暴風雨來臨之前迅速飄過天空。

New Words.句子: His happiness fleeted as reality set in
New Words.中文: 他的快樂隨著現實的到來而迅速消失。

New Words.句子: The boat was fleeted down the river by the strong current
New Words.中文: 這艘船被強烈的水流沖向河下。

New Words.句子: The company expanded its fleet of delivery trucks
New Words.中文: 公司擴展了其配送卡車的車隊。

New Words.句子: A fleet of taxis was waiting outside the airport
New Words.中文: 一隊計程車正等候在機場外。

New Words.句子: A fleet of birds soared across the sky
New Words.中文: 一群鳥群在天空中翱翔。

New Words.句子: The fishing fleet returned to shore before the storm hit
New Words.中文: 漁船隊在風暴來臨前返回岸邊。

New Words.句子: The deer was too fleet for the hunter to catch
New Words.中文: 那隻鹿跑得太快，獵人無法追上。

New Words.句子: She was known for her fleet movements on the track
New Words.中文: 她因在跑道上的迅捷動作而聞名。

New Words.句子: His fleet fingers played the piano with incredible speed
New Words.中文: 他那雙迅捷的手指以驚人的速度彈奏鋼琴。

New Words.句子: Time fleeted away as they enjoyed the evening
New Words.中文: 時間在他們享受晚上的時光中飛快地流逝。

New Words.句子: She caught a fleeting glimpse of the sunset before it disappeared
New Words.中文: 她匆匆瞥見夕陽一眼，然後它就消失了。

New Words.句子: Their happiness was fleeting, vanishing as quickly as it came
New Words.中文: 他們的快樂是短暫的，來得快，去得也快。

New Words.句子: He felt a fleeting sense of regret before moving on
New Words.中文: 他感到一絲短暫的懊悔，隨後便繼續前行。

New Words.句子: The days were fleeting as summer came to an end
New Words.中文: 隨著夏天的結束，日子匆匆而過。

New Words.句子: His thoughts kept fleeting from one idea to another
New Words.中文: 他的思緒不停地從一個想法跳到另一個想法。

New Words.句子: The boat was floating gently on the calm lake
New Words.中文: 小船輕輕地漂浮在平靜的湖面上。

New Words.句子: She noticed a leaf floating on the surface of the water
New Words.中文: 她注意到一片葉子漂浮在水面上。

New Words.句子: The balloon was floating away in the breeze
New Words.中文: 氣球在微風中飄走了。

New Words.句子: The birds were floating in the sky, soaring effortlessly
New Words.中文: 鳥兒在天空中漂浮，自由翱翔，輕鬆自如。

New Words.句子: The flood caused widespread damage to homes and roads
New Words.中文: 洪水對房屋和道路造成了廣泛的破壞。

New Words.句子: The river flooded after several days of continuous rain
New Words.中文: 經過幾天的連續降雨後，河流發生了洪水。

New Words.句子: They had to evacuate the town due to the rising floodwaters
New Words.中文: 由於洪水水位上升，他們不得不疏散小鎮居民。

New Words.句子: A flood of emotions overcame her as she received the news
New Words.中文: 當她收到消息時，情緒如洪水般湧上心頭。

New Words.句子: The company received a flood of applications after the job posting
New Words.中文: 在發布招聘信息後，公司收到了大量的申請。

New Words.句子: The river flooded the nearby fields after the storm
New Words.中文: 暴風雨過後，河流將附近的田地淹沒了。

New Words.句子: Streets were flooded after the downpour
New Words.中文: 大雨過後，街道被淹沒了。

New Words.句子: They flooded the market with new products
New Words.中文: 他們將市場填滿了新產品。

New Words.句子: Her inbox was flooded with emails after the announcement
New Words.中文: 公告發布後，她的收件箱被大量電子郵件塞滿。

New Words.句子: The room was decorated with floral curtains, adding a touch of elegance and charm with their vibrant flower patterns
New Words.中文: 房間裝飾著花卉窗簾，鮮豔的花卉圖案為房間增添了一絲優雅和魅力。

New Words.句子: A floral scene captures the fleeting beauty of nature with every brushstroke.
New Words.中文: 花卉景象用每一筆觸捕捉大自然稍縱即逝的美麗。

New Words.句子: A touch of floral design brings elegance and freshness to any creation.
New Words.中文: 加入花卉設計能為任何作品帶來優雅與清新。

New Words.句子: Floral patterns are timeless, embodying both romance and vitality.
New Words.中文: 花卉圖案是永恆的，蘊含著浪漫與生命力。

New Words.句子: The temperature fluctuated throughout the day, making it hard to dress appropriately
New Words.中文: 氣溫在一天中波動不定，讓人難以適當穿著。

New Words.句子: Prices of goods fluctuate based on supply and demand
New Words.中文: 氣溫在一天中波動不定，讓人難以適當穿著。

New Words.句子: Her mood fluctuated between excitement and anxiety as the event approached
New Words.中文: 隨著活動的臨近，她的情緒在興奮和焦慮之間波動。

New Words.句子: The stock market can fluctuate greatly in response to economic news
New Words.中文: 股市可能會因經濟新聞而大幅波動。

New Words.句子: His interest in the hobby fluctuated over the years
New Words.中文: 他對這項愛好的興趣隨著時間波動。

New Words.句子: There was a fluctuation in the stock market prices throughout the day
New Words.中文: 股市價格整天都有波動。

New Words.句子: The fluctuation of temperatures during the spring can be unpredictable
New Words.中文: 春季氣溫的波動可能難以預測。

New Words.句子: The fluctuation in demand affected the company's sales
New Words.中文: 需求的波動影響了公司的銷售。

New Words.句子: Water is a common fluid that fills lakes, rivers, and oceans
New Words.中文: 水是一種常見的液體，充滿了湖泊、河流和海洋。

New Words.句子: The dancer moved with fluid movements across the stage
New Words.中文: 那位舞者在舞台上以流暢的動作舞動。

New Words.句子: His fluid leadership style allows him to adjust to different situations effectively
New Words.中文: 他流暢的領導風格使他能夠有效地適應不同的情況。

New Words.句子: Oil is a fluid that can be used in various industrial processes
New Words.中文: 油是一種流體，可以用於各種工業過程。

New Words.句子: His fluid gestures made the presentation captivating
New Words.中文: 他的流暢手勢使得演示充滿吸引力。

New Words.句子: The company's fluid strategy enables it to respond quickly to market changes
New Words.中文: 該公司的靈活策略使其能夠迅速應對市場變化。

New Words.句子: This bottle of wine has lost its fluidity
New Words.中文: 這瓶葡萄酒已經失去了流動性。

New Words.句子: OpenAI has achieved a level of fluidity in Sora that makes the videos feel real
New Words.中文: OpenAI 在 Sora 中達到了某種流暢度，使得影片感覺非常真實。

New Words.句子: The fluidity of water allows it to easily take the shape of its container
New Words.中文: 水的流動性使它能輕易地適應容器的形狀。

New Words.句子: Her speech had a remarkable fluidity, making it easy for the audience to follow her ideas
New Words.中文: 她的演講具有卓越的流暢性，使觀眾能輕鬆跟隨她的想法。

New Words.句子: She flushed the toilet after use
New Words.中文: (她用完後沖了馬桶。)

New Words.句子: The pipes were flushed to clear out the debris
New Words.中文: (管道被沖洗以清除碎片。)

New Words.句子: He flushed with embarrassment after his mistake was pointed out
New Words.中文: (在他的錯誤被指出後，他因羞愧而臉紅。)

New Words.句子: She flushed with excitement when she heard the good news
New Words.中文: (她聽到好消息時興奮得臉紅了。)

New Words.句子: The magnet must be flush with the surface of the plastic part to ensure proper fit
New Words.中文: (磁鐵必須與塑料部件的表面齊平，以確保適當的配合。)

New Words.句子: The cabinet doors were installed flush with the wall for a smooth look
New Words.中文: (櫥櫃門被安裝得與牆面齊平，以達到平滑的外觀。)

New Words.句子: The toilet flush was loud and quick
New Words.中文: (馬桶的沖水聲又大又快。)

New Words.句子: A flush of water washed away the dirt in the stream
New Words.中文: (一股水流沖走了溪流中的泥土。)

New Words.句子: She wrapped the leftovers in foil to keep them fresh
New Words.中文: 她用鋁箔包裹剩菜，以保持新鮮。

New Words.句子: The chef covered the dish with a sheet of foil before baking
New Words.中文: 廚師在烘烤前用一層鋁箔蓋住了菜肴。

New Words.句子: He used kitchen foil to cover the baking tray and prevent sticking
New Words.中文: 他使用廚房鋁箔覆蓋烤盤，以防止食物粘黏。

New Words.句子: Watson serves as a foil to Sherlock Holmes, emphasizing Holmes' brilliance and eccentricity
New Words.中文: 華生是福爾摩斯的對照角色，突顯了福爾摩斯的才華和怪異。

New Words.句子: The quiet, reserved character acted as a foil to the loud, extroverted one
New Words.中文: 安靜內向的角色成為了大聲外向角色的對照，突顯了兩者的不同。

New Words.句子: The team's defense was able to foil the opponent's attempts to score
New Words.中文: 該隊的防守成功挫敗了對手的得分嘗試。

New Words.句子: She foiled his plan to sneak out by hiding his keys
New Words.中文: 她通過藏起他的鑰匙，挫敗了他偷偷溜出去的計劃。

New Words.句子: As they sat together reminiscing, they shared fond memories of their childhood adventures and family vacations
She developed a fondness for the small town she grew up in, cherishing its familiar streets and friendly neighbors
She has a fondness for red wine
The report used a professional font like Times New Roman for its text
New Words.中文: (報告使用了像 Times New Roman 這樣的專業字體來編排文字。)

New Words.句子: She chose a playful font for the invitation to match the party's theme
New Words.中文: (她選擇了一種富有趣味的字體來配合派對的主題。)

New Words.句子: Modern websites often use sans serif fonts for readability.
New Words.中文: (現代網站通常使用無襯線字體以提高可讀性。)

New Words.句子: Changing the font size can improve accessibility for readers
New Words.中文: (改變字體大小可以提高讀者的可讀性。)

New Words.句子: The priest poured water from the font during the baptism ceremony
New Words.中文: （牧師在洗禮儀式中從聖水盆倒水。）

New Words.句子: The historic font in the cathedral was carved from marble
New Words.中文: （大教堂內的歷史悠久的聖水盆是用大理石雕刻而成的。）

New Words.句子: The new software is foolproof, so even beginners can use it without any problems
They came up with a foolproof plan to ensure the event would run smoothly
This cake recipe is foolproof—there's almost no way to mess it up
The installation process is foolproof, with clear instructions and no complicated steps
The folding mechanism isn't entirely foolproof, but once you learn it, you'll never forget how to do it
The sudden drop in stock prices seemed to forebode an economic downturn, causing investors to become increasingly cautious
As the storm clouds gathered overhead, a sense of foreboding settled over the town, hinting at the impending danger of the approaching hurricane
Her sudden silence and downcast eyes filled the room with a heavy sense of foreboding, leaving everyone wondering what troubling news she might reveal
The company has been at the forefront of renewable energy technology for years
He was at the forefront of the movement to improve public education
The new product places the brand at the forefront of the tech industry
The discussion has brought the issue of health care to the forefront
The flowers in the foreground of the painting draw the viewer's attention
New Words.中文: （畫作前景的花朵吸引了觀賞者的注意。）

New Words.句子: In the photo, the mountains are in the background, while the forest dominates the foreground
New Words.中文: （在照片中，群山位於背景，而森林占據了前景。）

New Words.句子: The discussion brought the issue of climate change to the foreground of public concern
New Words.中文: （這場討論使氣候變遷問題成為公眾關注的焦點。）

New Words.句子: The report foregrounds the importance of mental health support in schools
New Words.中文: （該報告突出了學校心理健康支援的重要性。）

New Words.句子: The film foregrounded the struggles of the protagonist to create a more emotional narrative
New Words.中文: （這部電影突出了主角的掙扎，以營造更具情感的敘事。）

New Words.句子: The designer foregrounded simplicity in the product’s design to enhance user experience
New Words.中文: （設計師強調產品設計的簡約性，以提升使用者體驗。）

New Words.句子: She could foresee the challenges ahead and prepared accordingly
New Words.中文: 她能預見前方的挑戰，並做了相應的準備。

New Words.句子: They foresaw a rise in demand for their product during the holiday season
New Words.中文: 他們預見到假期期間，產品需求將會上升。

New Words.句子: He is able to foresee potential problems before they arise
New Words.中文: 他能夠在問題出現之前預見到潛在的問題。

New Words.句子: The forest fire consumed thousands of acres of woodland and displaced many animals
Firefighters worked tirelessly to contain the forest fire before it reached nearby homes
The smoke from the forest fire was visible from miles away, affecting air quality in surrounding areas
The archaeologist uncovered a fossil of a leaf that dates back millions of years
A well-preserved dinosaur fossil was displayed in the museum
My grandfather is a bit of a fossil; he still thinks we should use typewriters instead of computers

A beautiful stone fountain was set in the middle of the garden

The fabric on the sofa began to fray after years of use
The CEO stayed above the fray, allowing the managers to handle the internal conflicts
As the debate heated up, their patience started to fray

He jumped into the fray, eager to defend his position
After a few moments of argument, the fray escalated into a full-blown dispute

The front crawl is commonly used in triathlons due to its efficiency

New Words.句子: She was diagnosed with frozen shoulder after experiencing persistent pain and difficulty raising her arm

New Words.中文: 物理治療通常被建議用來幫助改善五十肩患者的活動能力。

New Words.中文: 五十肩的症狀可能需要數月甚至數年才能完全痊癒。

New Words.中文: 五十肩的治療選項可能包括疼痛管理、伸展運動，有時還需注射治療。

New Words.句子: Gasoline is a common fuel used in automobiles

New Words.中文: 他們用一張新沙發和咖啡桌裝飾了客廳。

New Words.句子: The charity gala raised a significant amount of money for the cause

New Words.中文: 她花了多年時間研究她的家譜，以了解更多關於她的祖先的資料。

New Words.句子: The family proudly displayed their genealogy, showing their connections to notable historical figures
New Words.中文: 這個家庭自豪地展示了他們的家譜，顯示了他們與著名歷史人物的聯繫。

New Words.中文: 家譜記錄可以提供有價值的見解，幫助了解一個人的祖先背景。

New Words.句子: Many people benefited from his countless generosities

New Words.句子: The room was decorated with geometric wallpaper, featuring repeating triangles and hexagons

New Words.句子: The toy set included several geometric shapes such as circles, triangles, squares, pentagons, hexagons, and octagons

New Words.句子: The math lesson covered various 3D geometric shapes, including cubes, spheres, cones, pyramids, and cylinders
New Words.中文: 數學課程涵蓋了各種三維幾何圖形，包括立方體、球體、圓錐體、金字塔和圓柱體。

New Words.句子: In geometry class, we learned how to calculate the area of a circle
New Words.中文: 在幾何課上，我們學會了如何計算圓的面積。

New Words.句子: The principles of geometry are applied in architecture and engineering
New Words.中文: 幾何原理被應用於建築與工程領域中。

New Words.句子: The geometry of the building's design allows for maximum light exposure
New Words.中文: 這座建築的幾何設計讓自然光得以最大程度地照射進來。

New Words.中文: 自行車的幾何設計會影響騎乘時的舒適度與性能。

New Words.句子: The glamorous actress captivated the audience with her stunning performance

New Words.中文: 畫框上以金箔精美裝飾，使它在畫廊中格外引人注目。

New Words.句子: The artist used gold leaf to highlight the intricate details of the manuscript
New Words.中文: 這位藝術家使用金箔來突顯手稿中精緻的細節。

New Words.句子: The chef created a gold leaf hamburger, a luxurious dish for special occasions
New Words.中文: 這位廚師創造了一款金箔漢堡，這是一道適合特殊場合的奢華料理。

New Words.句子: The office was filled with gossip about who was dating whom
New Words.中文: 辦公室裡充滿了關於誰和誰約會的八卦。

New Words.句子: She didn’t want to engage in gossip during lunch but couldn’t help overhearing the conversation
New Words.中文: 她不想在午餐時參與八卦，但忍不住聽到那段對話。

New Words.中文: 在小鎮上，八卦傳得很快，讓人難以保守祕密。

New Words.句子: Don't tell her anything, She is a gossip
New Words.中文: 別告訴她任何事情，她是個八卦的人。

New Words.句子: They often gossip about their neighbors during their coffee breaks
New Words.中文: 他們經常在咖啡休息時間八卦鄰居的事。

New Words.句子: She loves to gossip with her friends about the latest celebrity news
New Words.中文: 她喜歡和朋友們八卦最新的名人新聞。

New Words.句子: After the meeting, they gossiped about the new project manager's unusual style
New Words.中文: 會議後，他們八卦了新項目經理不同尋常的風格。

New Words.句子: They spent the afternoon gossiping on the phone
New Words.中文: 他們整個下午都在電話裡八卦。

New Words.句子: Sarah is the go-to person for event planning in our office
New Words.中文: （Sarah 是我們辦公室負責活動策劃的首選人物。）

New Words.句子: This restaurant is my go-to choice for quick and delicious meals
New Words.中文: （這家餐廳是我快速又美味餐點的首選。）

New Words.句子: Whenever parents need to travel with their little ones, this compact stroller is the go-to item; its lightweight design and convenient features make navigating airports, parks, and crowded streets a breeze
New Words.中文: （每當父母需要帶著孩子旅行時，這款輕便的推車是首選；其輕巧的設計和便利的功能使得穿越機場、公園和擁擠的街道變得輕鬆無比。）

New Words.句子: Jane has become the team's go-to for graphic design work
New Words.中文: （簡已經成為團隊的圖形設計工作首選。）

New Words.句子: My sister is always my go-to for fashion advice before meeting someone special
New Words.中文: （在見某個特別的人之前，我總是會向我姐姐請教時尚建議。）

New Words.句子: She styled four ultra-chic looks for the new season, combining both winter go-to’s and some on-trend pieces for spring
New Words.中文: （她為新季節打造了四個超時尚的造型，將冬季必備單品和一些春季流行單品相結合。）

New Words.句子: Whenever I need English consultancy, ChatGPT is my go-to tool; its insightful responses and language expertise consistently help me refine my communication skills
New Words.中文: （每當我需要英語諮詢時，ChatGPT 是我首選的工具；它的深刻回應和語言專業知識不斷幫助我提升溝通技巧。）

New Words.句子: They enjoyed a gourmet meal at the upscale restaurant
New Words.中文: (他們在高檔餐廳享受了一頓美食盛宴)。

New Words.句子: She always seeks out gourmet ingredients for her cooking
New Words.中文: (她總是為她的烹飪尋找精緻的食材)。

New Words.句子: As a gourmet, he appreciates the art of food preparation and presentation
New Words.中文: (作為一名美食家，他欣賞食物製作和擺盤的藝術)。

New Words.句子: The gourmet praised the chef for his innovative menu
New Words.中文: (美食家讚揚廚師的創新菜單)。

New Words.句子: Many gourmets enjoy attending food festivals to sample different cuisines

New Words.中文: 她運用自己的智慧，為問題想出了創新的解決方案。

New Words.句子: The university is known for attracting some of the brightest intellects in the country
New Words.中文: 這所大學以吸引國內最聰明的才智之士而聞名。

New Words.句子: She is considered an intellect in the field of neuroscience
New Words.中文: 她在神經科學領域被認為是一位才智出眾的人物。

New Words.句子: She is considered an intellectual for her contributions to the field of philosophy
New Words.中文: 她因對哲學領域的貢獻而被認為是一位知識分子。

New Words.句子: Many intellectuals gathered to discuss the implications of the latest scientific discoveries
New Words.中文: 許多知識分子聚集一堂，討論最新科學發現的影響。

New Words.句子: He enjoys engaging in intellectual debates about politics and economics
New Words.中文: 他喜歡參與關於政治和經濟的知識性辯論。

New Words.句子: The book provides an intellectual challenge to readers with its complex theories
New Words.中文: 這本書以其複雜的理論為讀者提供了智力挑戰。

New Words.句子: The website offers an interactive quiz to test your knowledge on history
New Words.中文: （這個網站提供了一個互動式小測驗，來測試你對歷史的知識。）

New Words.句子: Video games have become more interactive, allowing players to control the storyline through their choices
New Words.中文: （電子遊戲變得更加互動，允許玩家透過自己的選擇來控制故事情節。）

New Words.句子: The workshop was highly interactive, encouraging group discussions and problem-solving
New Words.中文: （這個工作坊非常互動，鼓勵小組討論和解決問題。）

New Words.句子: The teacher designed interactive lessons to keep students engaged and involved in the learning process
New Words.中文: （老師設計了互動性課程，讓學生保持專注並參與學習過程。）

New Words.句子: The interviewee answered all the questions with confidence and clarity
New Words.中文: 受訪者以自信和清晰的態度回答了所有問題。

New Words.句子: The interviewer was impressed by the interviewee's qualifications and experience
New Words.中文: 面試官對受訪者的資歷和經驗印象深刻。

New Words.句子: As an interviewee, it is important to be prepared and showcase your strengths
New Words.中文: 作為受訪者，做好準備並展現自己的優勢非常重要。

New Words.句子: The doctor explained that nutrients are absorbed in the small intestine
New Words.中文: 醫生解釋說，營養素在小腸中被吸收。

New Words.句子: A blockage in the intestine can cause severe abdominal pain
New Words.中文: 腸道阻塞可能導致嚴重的腹痛。

New Words.句子: The large intestine is responsible for absorbing water from digested food
New Words.中文: 大腸負責從消化食物中吸收水分。

New Words.句子: They have been intimate friends for over a decade
New Words.中文: （他們是多年的親密朋友。）

New Words.句子: The restaurant had an intimate atmosphere, perfect for a quiet dinner
New Words.中文: （餐廳有一種親密的氛圍，非常適合安靜的晚餐。）

New Words.句子: She shared her most intimate thoughts with her closest friend
New Words.中文: （她與最親密的朋友分享了她最私密的想法。）

New Words.句子: He intimated that he might be moving to a new city soon
New Words.中文: （他暗示他可能很快會搬到新城市。）

New Words.句子: She intimated her concerns during the meeting without stating them directly
New Words.中文: （她在會議中暗示了她的擔憂，並未直接說出來。）

New Words.句子: She confided her secrets to her most trusted intimate
New Words.中文: （她把她的秘密託付給她最信任的親密朋友。）

New Words.句子: The party was attended by a few close intimates
New Words.中文: （派對上出席的是一些親密的朋友。）

New Words.句子: She has an intuitive understanding of how people feel, even without them saying a word
New Words.中文: 她對人們的感受有種直覺的理解，即使他們一句話也沒說。

New Words.句子: The software’s intuitive design makes it easy for users to navigate without any training
New Words.中文: 這款軟體的直觀設計讓使用者無需任何培訓就能輕鬆操作。

New Words.句子: His intuitive approach to solving problems often leads him to the right answers quickly
New Words.中文: 他解決問題的直覺方法常常讓他很快找到正確答案。

New Words.句子: His irrational fear of spiders made it difficult for him to enjoy the outdoors
New Words.中文: 他對蜘蛛的非理性恐懼讓他很難享受戶外活動。

New Words.句子: The decision to invest all his money in one risky venture was completely irrational
New Words.中文: 把他所有的錢投資在一個高風險事業上的決定完全是非理性的。

New Words.句子: She was acting irrationally, letting her emotions control her actions
New Words.中文: 她行為非理性，讓情緒控制了她的行動。

New Words.句子: The constant noise from the construction site caused her irritation
New Words.中文: 建築工地持續的噪音引起了她的煩躁。

New Words.句子: His rude comments led to irritation among the group members
New Words.中文: 他的粗魯評論引起了小組成員的惱怒。

New Words.句子: The irritation on her skin was due to the harsh chemicals in the lotion
New Words.中文: 她皮膚上的刺激是由於潤膚露中含有的刺激性化學物質。

New Words.句子: The rash caused by the plant's oils resulted in irritation and itching
New Words.中文: 植物油脂引起的皮疹導致了刺激和瘙癢。

New Words.句子: The car tire had a jag from running over a sharp object
There was a jag in the rock that made climbing difficult
She went on a shopping jag, buying everything she could find
The musician went on a creative jag, producing a new song every day
He jagged the paper with a pair of scissors for a rough look
The rock jags outward, making it difficult to navigate
He jagged on junk food all weekend during the party
She jagged through the project, staying up all night to finish it
The mountain peak had jagged rocks that made it dangerous to climb
The glass broke into jagged pieces, scattered all over the floor
The jagged edges of the torn paper made it hard to handle
The jagged lines of the coastline created dramatic cliffs
The jagged scars on his face told a story of years of hardship
She wore a beautiful piece of jewelry that was passed down from her grandmother
New Words.中文: 她戴著一件從祖母那裡傳下來的漂亮珠寶。

New Words.句子: The store sells a wide variety of jewelry, including diamond rings and gold necklaces
New Words.中文: 這家店出售各種各樣的珠寶，包括鑽石戒指和金項鍊。

New Words.句子: The necklace was adorned with sparkling gemstones, making it a stunning piece of jewelry
New Words.中文: 這條項鍊鑲滿了閃閃發光的寶石，使它成為一件驚艷的珠寶。

New Words.句子: The journalist interviewed the mayor to get more details about the new policy
New Words.中文: 記者採訪市長，以獲取有關新政策的更多細節。

New Words.句子: She has been a journalist for over a decade, covering international news
New Words.中文: 她從事新聞工作超過十年，專注報導國際新聞。

New Words.句子: The journalist’s report on the climate change summit was published in several major newspapers
New Words.中文: 這位記者關於氣候變遷峰會的報導刊登在多家主要報紙上。

New Words.句子: The magazine article juxtaposes before-and-after photos to demonstrate the effectiveness of the fitness program
The exhibit juxtaposes ancient artifacts with modern technology to illustrate the evolution of communication over time
An industrial designer might juxtapose sleek, minimalist form with highly functional features in a new smartphone design
The photographer decided to juxtapose the bright colors of the flowers against the dark background to create a striking image
The juxtaposition of the old and new buildings created an interesting visual contrast in the city
The artist used the juxtaposition of light and dark colors to convey the theme of duality in the painting
The doctor said his kidneys are functioning well
New Words.中文: 醫生說他的腎臟功能良好。

New Words.句子: She donated a kidney to her brother
New Words.中文: 她將一顆腎臟捐給了她的哥哥。

New Words.句子: The patient received a kidney transplant
New Words.中文: 患者接受了腎臟移植手術。

New Words.句子: His kidney disease requires regular dialysis
New Words.中文: 他的腎病需要定期透析治療。

New Words.句子: I enjoyed a traditional dish of steak and kidney pie at the pub
New Words.中文: 我在酒館享用了一道傳統菜餚——牛排腰子派。

New Words.句子: The landscape view from the hilltop stretched for miles, showing the valley below
New Words.中文: （從山頂的景觀延伸了數英里，展示了下面的山谷。）

New Words.句子: The artist painted a beautiful landscape view of the ocean at sunset
New Words.中文: （藝術家畫了一幅美麗的海洋日落景觀。）

New Words.句子: We enjoyed a magnificent landscape view from the top of the mountain, with a clear view of the entire valley
New Words.中文: （我們在山頂欣賞了壯麗的景觀，清晰地看見整個山谷。）

New Words.句子: The butterfly's life cycle includes a stage where it is a larva, commonly known as a caterpillar
New Words.中文: 蝴蝶的生命週期包括一個階段是幼蟲，通常被稱為毛毛蟲。

New Words.句子: Tadpoles are the larvae of frogs, living in water before they mature into adult frogs
New Words.中文: 蝌蚪是青蛙的幼體，生活在水中，之後才會成長為成蛙。

New Words.句子: The ancient lava flows from the volcano sculpted the rugged landscape of the region, leaving behind dramatic cliffs and valleys
New Words.中文: 火山的古老熔岩流塑造了該地區崎嶇的地貌，留下了壯觀的懸崖與山谷。

New Words.句子: The landscape was covered with rough lava from the last eruption
New Words.中文: 這片地貌覆蓋著上次火山爆發所留下的粗糙熔岩。

New Words.句子: They hiked across a field of ancient lava flows
New Words.中文: 他們徒步穿越了一片古老的熔岩流地帶。

New Words.句子: The red-hot lava flowed down the mountainside, destroying everything in its path
New Words.中文: 炙熱的熔岩順著山坡流下，摧毀了沿途的一切。

New Words.句子: We had leftovers from dinner, so we don’t need to cook tonight
New Words.中文: （我們有晚餐剩菜，所以今晚不需要做飯。）

New Words.句子: There were a few leftovers after the party, and we packed them up for later
New Words.中文: （派對後剩下了一些食物，我們把它們收拾起來留著以後吃。）

New Words.句子: I used the leftover fabric to make a small pillow
New Words.中文: （我用剩下的布料做了一個小枕頭。）

New Words.句子: The leftover cake from the birthday party was delicious the next day
New Words.中文: （生日派對剩下的蛋糕隔天依然很好吃。）

New Words.句子: A creative chef can turn simple leftovers into a masterpiece.
New Words.中文: 有創意的廚師能將普通的剩菜變成一份傑作。

New Words.句子: Waste not, want not—leftovers can always serve a new purpose.
New Words.中文: 物盡其用，則無匱乏——剩餘之物總能發揮新的價值。

New Words.句子: The librarian helped me locate the book I needed for my research
New Words.中文: 圖書館員幫我找到我研究所需的那本書。

New Words.句子: She has been a librarian for over 15 years and loves recommending books to visitors
New Words.中文: 她當圖書館員已超過十五年，熱愛向訪客推薦書籍。

New Words.句子: The librarian organized a reading event for children during the summer break
New Words.中文: 圖書館員在暑假期間為兒童舉辦了一場閱讀活動。

New Words.句子: Creativity is the lifeblood of the fashion industry
New Words.中文: (創造力是時尚產業的命脈)。

New Words.句子: Diamond is the lifeblood of South Africa's economy
New Words.中文: (鑽石是南非經濟的命脈)。

New Words.句子: Water is the lifeblood of agriculture in the region, without which crops cannot grow
New Words.中文: (水是該地區農業的命脈，沒有水作物無法生長)。

New Words.句子: In ancient times, warriors were willing to shed their lifeblood for their country
New Words.中文: (在古代，戰士們願意為國家捨命)。

New Words.句子: Shakespeare's plays are some of the most famous works of English literature
New Words.中文: 莎士比亞的戲劇是英國文學中最著名的作品之一。

New Words.句子: She studied French literature at university to better understand the country’s culture
New Words.中文: 她在大學學習法國文學，以更好地理解該國的文化。

New Words.句子: The scientist reviewed the literature on climate change before publishing his paper
New Words.中文: 這位科學家在發表論文之前，先檢視了有關氣候變遷的文獻。

New Words.句子: The company distributed promotional literature to advertise their new product
New Words.中文: 公司發放了宣傳冊來廣告他們的新產品。

New Words.句子: The lofty mountains stretched into the sky, their peaks covered in snow
New Words.中文: 崇高的山脈伸向天空，山峰覆蓋著雪。

New Words.句子: The skyscraper had lofty ceilings that gave the building a grand appearance
New Words.中文: 這座摩天大樓擁有高聳的天花板，給建築帶來了宏偉的外觀。

New Words.句子: His lofty goals of curing diseases and improving the world inspired many
New Words.中文: 他治癒疾病和改善世界的崇高目標激勵了許多人。

New Words.句子: She maintained lofty principles even in difficult situations
New Words.中文: 即使在困難的情況下，她也保持著崇高的原則。

New Words.句子: His lofty demeanor made it difficult for others to approach him
New Words.中文: 他高傲的態度讓其他人很難接近他。

New Words.句子: The manager's lofty attitude alienated her colleagues
New Words.中文: 經理高傲的態度疏遠了她的同事。

New Words.句子: The car dealer lowballed me on the price, offering a much lower trade-in value than expected
New Words.中文: 汽車經銷商給了我很低的報價，提供的以舊換新價遠低於預期。

New Words.句子: He lowballed the price of the car to make the negotiation seem more favorable
New Words.中文: 他故意報低車價，使得談判看起來對他更有利。

New Words.句子: He lowballed the estimate to make the project seem less expensive
New Words.中文: 他故意報低預算，讓這個項目看起來較便宜。

New Words.句子: The lowball he received for his house was far below the market value
New Words.中文: 他收到的房屋低報價遠低於市場價值。

New Words.句子: She rejected the lowball and countered with a higher offer
New Words.中文: 她拒絕了低報價，並提出了更高的反報價。

New Words.句子: They made a lowball offer for the house, hoping the seller would accept
New Words.中文: 他們對房子提出了低報價，希望賣家會接受。

New Words.句子: They stayed in a luxurious hotel overlooking the ocean
New Words.中文: 他們住在一間奢華的飯店，能夠俯瞰大海。

New Words.句子: She enjoyed a luxurious bath after a long day at work
New Words.中文: 她在一天忙碌的工作後，享受了一場奢華的泡澡。

New Words.句子: The car’s luxurious interior featured leather seats and a state-of-the-art sound system
New Words.中文: 這輛車的奢華內裝配有皮革座椅和最先進的音響系統。

New Words.句子: He led a luxurious lifestyle, traveling in private jets and dining at five-star restaurants
New Words.中文: 他過著奢華的生活方式，搭乘私人飛機旅行，並在五星級餐廳用餐。

New Words.句子: She had luxurious tastes and preferred designer brands
New Words.中文: 她有著奢華的品味，偏好設計師品牌。

New Words.句子: The factory's machinery is equipped with the latest automation technology
The machinery used in construction sites is designed for heavy-duty tasks
The car's engine is a complex piece of machinery that requires regular maintenance
The machinery in the lab helps process scientific data quickly
The constant noise from the construction site was absolutely maddening
New Words.中文: 建築工地持續不斷的噪音實在令人抓狂。

New Words.句子: His stubborn refusal to listen was maddening
New Words.中文: 他固執地拒絕傾聽，真是令人惱火。

New Words.句子: It’s maddening how slowly the website loads sometimes
New Words.中文: 網站有時加載得那麼慢，真是令人抓狂。

New Words.句子: She found his indecisiveness maddening, especially under pressure
New Words.中文: 她覺得他優柔寡斷令人抓狂，尤其是在壓力下。

New Words.句子: The magician pulled a rabbit out of his hat, amazing the audience
New Words.中文: (魔術師從帽子裡拿出一隻兔子，讓觀眾驚嘆不已)。

New Words.句子: She hired a magician to perform at her son's birthday party
New Words.中文: (她聘請了一位魔術師來為她兒子的生日派對表演)。

New Words.句子: He is a magician in the kitchen, creating incredible dishes from simple ingredients
New Words.中文: (他在廚房裡像魔術師一樣，將簡單的食材變出令人難以置信的菜餚)。

New Words.句子: The software developer was a magician when it came to solving complex coding problems
New Words.中文: (這位軟體開發者在解決複雜的程式碼問題時像魔術師一樣)。

New Words.句子: The makeup artist transformed the actress's look for the red carpet premiere
New Words.中文: (化妝師為女演員的紅毯首映改變了她的造型)。

New Words.句子: She hired a makeup artist for her wedding day to ensure she looked flawless
New Words.中文: (她在婚禮當天聘請了化妝師，確保自己看起來完美無瑕)。

New Words.句子: The makeup artist demonstrated various techniques during the beauty workshop
New Words.中文: (化妝師在美妝研討會上展示了各種化妝技巧)。

New Words.句子: It is mandatory for all employees to complete the annual safety training
New Words.中文: 所有員工必須完成年度安全訓練，這是強制性的。

New Words.句子: The new regulations make it mandatory to wear seat belts in all vehicles
New Words.中文: 新規定要求在所有車輛中佩戴安全帶，這是強制性的。

New Words.句子: Filing a tax return by the deadline is mandatory to avoid legal penalties
New Words.中文: 在截止日期前提交報稅表是強制性的，以避免法律處罰。

New Words.句子: The driver executed a difficult maneuver to avoid hitting the curb
We maneuvered our troops to the south
The aircraft performed a series of maneuvers to demonstrate its agility
The company's merger was part of a larger financial maneuver to dominate the market
The chess player made a brilliant maneuver that led to a quick checkmate
To prepare for war, the army is performing maneuvers off the coast
He maneuvered the stroller around the tight corners of the park
The pilot carefully maneuvered the plane through the stormy weather
The politician maneuvered through the debate, carefully avoiding controversial topics
She maneuvered her way into a higher position within the company
The company manufactures high-quality strollers in a state-of-the-art factory
They manufacture electronics at the factory using automated processes
The team is working hard to manufacture the new stroller model for the upcoming launch
The story about the accident was manufactured to divert attention from the real issue
He felt the company was manufacturing its success through misleading advertisements
The country has seen a significant rise in the manufacture of electric vehicles
The manufacture of clothing in the region provides thousands of jobs
Advances in the manufacture of materials have led to more durable and eco-friendly products
The manufacturing of electric vehicles has rapidly increased over the past decade
The city is known for its high-tech manufacturing industry, producing advanced electronics
Sustainable manufacturing practices are essential for reducing environmental impact
The manufacturing sector contributes significantly to the country's GDP
Many workers are employed in the manufacturing of consumer goods
The company invested in manufacturing technology to improve efficiency
Manufacturing companies are adopting automation to reduce costs and increase production
Many states have legalized the use of marijuana for medical purposes
New Words.中文: 許多州已經合法化了醫療用途的大麻。

New Words.句子: The doctor discussed the potential benefits and risks of using marijuana for chronic pain relief
New Words.中文: 醫生討論了使用大麻來緩解慢性疼痛的潛在益處與風險。

New Words.句子: Some people use marijuana to help them relax after a stressful day
New Words.中文: 有些人使用大麻來幫助他們在壓力大的日子後放鬆。

New Words.句子: Bone marrow transplants are often used to treat certain cancers
New Words.中文: 骨髓移植常用於治療某些類型的癌症。

New Words.句子: The doctors examined his bone marrow for signs of disease
New Words.中文: 醫生檢查了他的骨髓，尋找是否有疾病的跡象。

New Words.句子: The story’s message goes straight to the marrow of the human experience
New Words.中文: 故事的訊息直擊人類經歷的精髓。

New Words.句子: The look in his eyes chilled me to the marrow
New Words.中文: 他眼中的神情讓我不寒而慄。

New Words.句子: We were frozen to the marrow after standing in the cold for hours
New Words.中文: 我們在寒冷中站了幾個小時，冷得幾乎骨髓都凍僵了。

New Words.句子: She marveled at the beauty of the ancient artwork
New Words.中文: 她對那件古老藝術品的美麗驚嘆不已。

New Words.句子: He marveled at the complexity of the new technology
New Words.中文: 他對這項新科技的複雜性感到驚嘆。

New Words.句子: We marveled at how quickly the team completed the project
New Words.中文: 我們對團隊完成這項專案的速度感到驚嘆。

New Words.句子: They were marveling at the stunning view from the mountaintop
New Words.中文: 他們正對山頂上壯麗的景色感到驚嘆。

New Words.句子: The Great Wall of China is one of the modern marvels of the world
New Words.中文: 中國的長城是世界現代奇蹟之一。

New Words.句子: His quick thinking in a crisis was a marvel
New Words.中文: 他在危機中的快速反應真是一個奇蹟。

New Words.句子: The invention of the smartphone is considered a marvel of modern technology
New Words.中文: 智慧型手機的發明被認為是現代科技的一大奇蹟。

New Words.句子: The Mona Lisa is often regarded as Leonardo da Vinci’s greatest masterpiece
New Words.中文: 《蒙娜麗莎》常被視為達文西的偉大傑作。

New Words.句子: The film was hailed as a cinematic masterpiece, praised for its direction and acting
New Words.中文: 這部電影被譽為電影藝術的傑作，因其導演和演技而受到讚揚。

New Words.句子: The architect's final design was a true masterpiece, blending modern and classical elements
New Words.中文: 這位建築師的最終設計是一個真正的傑作，完美融合了現代和古典元素。

New Words.句子: His novel is considered a literary masterpiece, showcasing his unique storytelling ability
New Words.中文: 他的小說被認為是文學的傑作，展示了他獨特的敘事能力。

New Words.句子: She bought a new memory foam mattress for better sleep support
New Words.中文: （她買了一張新的記憶海綿床墊，以提供更好的睡眠支撐。）

New Words.句子: The hotel room featured a comfortable king-size mattress
New Words.中文: （酒店房間配有一張舒適的特大號床墊。）

New Words.句子: He flipped the mattress to prevent it from wearing unevenly
New Words.中文: （他翻轉床墊以防止其磨損不均。）

New Words.句子: The old mattress was too firm and caused back pain
New Words.中文: （舊床墊太硬，導致背痛。）

New Words.句子: The cows grazed peacefully in the meadow, surrounded by blooming flowers
New Words.中文: 牛群在草地上安靜地吃草，四周環繞著盛開的花朵。

New Words.句子: We spent the afternoon walking through the meadow, enjoying the fresh air and sunshine
New Words.中文: 我們花了一個下午在草地上散步，享受著新鮮的空氣和陽光。

New Words.句子: The meadow was filled with the sounds of birds singing and the rustle of grass in the breeze
New Words.中文: 草地上充滿了鳥兒歌唱的聲音和微風中草叢沙沙作響的聲音。

New Words.句子: A river ran through the meadow, adding to its tranquil beauty
New Words.中文: 一條河流穿過草地，增添了其寧靜的美麗。

New Words.句子: The herbal tea has many medicinal benefits, helping to soothe sore throats
New Words.中文: 這款草本茶具有許多藥用效益，有助於舒緩喉嚨疼痛。

New Words.句子: The medicinal use of marijuana is a topic of ongoing research and debate
New Words.中文: 大麻的藥用用途是持續研究和討論的議題。

New Words.句子: The doctor recommended a medicinal approach to managing her chronic pain
New Words.中文: 醫生建議採取藥物療法來管理她的慢性疼痛。

New Words.句子: The movie was mediocre—neither great nor terrible
New Words.中文: （這部電影平平無奇——既不精彩也不糟糕。）

New Words.句子: His performance in the competition was mediocre compared to the other contestants
New Words.中文: （他在比賽中的表現與其他參賽者相比算是平庸。）
